Review.Titre: Stay well away from AGA Rangemaster
Review.Contenu: Having purchased a Rangemaster Classic 110 gas cooker and hood it arrived damaged. When contacting Rangemaster they pass you onto a company called Repair care to deal with the repairs. They then book you and engineer that doesn't turn up as they have subbed the original job to another company called Domex. When contacting Domex they explained that they have no engineers available to carry out the repair on the arranged date. So basically Rangemaster take your money and then don't give a dam about the product they send out along with their non existent customer care service. The customer then has to scrabble about trying to find out who is responsible for carrying out  repairs to the damaged goods on behalf of Rangemaster. This company provides expensive cookers and hoods and no back up service. Be warned do not buy an Aga Rangemaster product if your hoping for reliable customer service.

We purchased a rangemaster professional + for our newly refurbished kitchen.The induction hob on the cooker has never been right, and has had so many problems rangemaster have had to extend the warranty for us.Our induction hob showed an error code again nearly 4 weeks ago. An engineer visited us and again agreed it was faulty and needed repairs. The rangemaster subcontractor then returned yesterday to “fix” our induction hob. He left our property having left the fault unresolved and we have had no feedback from him or rangemaster since!We are now left without a hob for the Christmas period and family to host.These cookers are not fit for purpose and the customer care team are slow to reply and of little help. I would never again purchase one of these ranges.

I thought I was buying a quality uk manufactured appliance. The induction hob failed after just 11 months error code E4 main PCB board burnt out. The Service Engineer informed me it’s a common fault and our Rangemaster is not manufactured in the uk and it’s most likely to fail again. After spending over £1000 it’s something we could have bought at ARGOS for 1/3 of what I paid.

Review.Titre: Awful call system to navigate through. Terrible Cust Serv
Review.Contenu: Awful call system to navigate through. Extremely unhelpful customer service.I'm a gas engineer and just spent 40 min on the phone trying to get to the right person. Once I got to the right person to find out a part number (which was not printed on the manual) they almost asked me for the client's blood group and all. Unless I provided every single bit of information (appliance age, purchase date etc etc, which I didn't have at the time) I couldn't get a simple advise on how to find it. I know Rangemaster like to repair their overly priced appliances themselves, but that doesn't mean they should try and cripple every 3rd party repair attempt.

We ordered a 90cm Rangemaster Professional+ Gas range cooker from John Lewis. We were told by them delivery would be on 5 December. We were then told by Rangemaster that delivery would be on 12 December.  Today we were told by Rangemaster that due to being let down by their supplier (of the gas ignition) we would not now get the cooker till some time in January. Bearing in mind that we specifically ordered the new cooker for Xmas as our current cooker isn't working and we have people coming, this came as a massive blow. It has been suggested that we could have the cooker in a different colour, then have the doors changed to the colour we actually ordered, at some later stage. Alternatively we could have a different model of cooker to the one we ordered. We are currently considering what to do. Very disappointed.

We have a Rangemaster cooker that is 20 years old and the gas jets on the hob needed attention.  The call out fee is £150 and we were told that the engineer probably would not have the parts so they order them and then thery charge a further £100 to come out again and fix it.  My husband had to pay the £150 in advance, and they said they would have to fix a date for the engineer and would get back to us. When he told me I said it was too expensive and wanted to look around so he phoned back 5 mins later - We were told there was a £36 cancellation charge!  We then found out that Rangemaster use Stellisons engineers.  We phoned them direct and their fee is about £99 plus parts and if they cannot fix and have to come back at a later date with the parts there is no additional fee. Rangemaster's potential £250 charge, plus parts is extrortionate and then charging a £36 cancellation fee after a 5 minute call when no engineer had been booked is scandalous !!although the repairtech firm they use to book appointments were unwilling to refund us the £36 Rangemaster have agreed to do so and will return the cancellation fee of £36 in January - thanks

Called them on Thursday 30th November 2023 as our range cooker gas ovens weren't igniting. They were quick to take a payment of £230 over the phone to book a service call with Repairtech Services. They told me to expect a call from the Repairtech engineer within two working days. Today, 5th December, by 4.30pm I'd had no call so called Rangemaster. Spoke to some bloke who sounded about 12 years old, told him the issue, he disappears for five minutes, only to come back and tell me that the local engineer hasn't been answering his phone or responding to emails for the past two days. I asked if there were any other engineers available to which he replies "no". All he could offer was to refund my money which according to him will take between five and seven working days. NOT GOOD ENOUGH RANGEMASTER!! I didn't spend two and a half thousand quid on a range cooker to receive appalling service like this. Would anyone from your end bothered to have called me seeing as your engineer has gone AWOL? I doubt it, I would have been left waiting for a call that was never going to come. I now have to find an engineer to come out before Christmas to fix the ovens and having called a few, no one can get to us before. Rangemaster, if this is how you treat your customers, then I will never buy anything from you again. Abysmal.

Review.Titre: Rangemaster wash their hands  of repairs.
Review.Contenu: We purchased our rangemaster induction 110 cooker 10 years ago and it has worked fine until now. However now the induction hob has a fault. Rangemaster won't repair it. They don't supply parts. They are most unhelpful.  Repairs have been sold off to another organisation which is little more than an agency. If a cooker/hob costing well over £3k can't be repaired be the company who made and sold it then it's not worth buying.

My old mum bought a Rangemaster cooker 11 month's ago. It is not fit for purpose and is currently on its third warranty repair. The warranty repair was hard to come by as it stated her 11 month old cooker was out of warranty when trying to organise a online warranty repair. Not to worry, after an hour on the phone and customer service online chat I managed to report the warranty repair to a customer service operator who thought it would be appropriate to send me a smiley face message when I was reporting my 86 year old mother does not have an oven to cook hot food with as its broken, again. The engineer came and did an initial inspection and advised the thermocoupler needed replacing and he would order one, three weeks later my mother still cannot cook hot food as they are having trouble sourcing one. I could get one next day delivery from Amazon though. She has now owned the cooker for a year and three days but has less than 11 months use due to the faults. It does not look good for when the warranty runs out if it breaks three times in the first year.

Purchased a cooler hood and classic fx.The hood came with a dent.The oven had damage to the bezel (incorrect screws had been used on the door and were hitting the frame). The internal finishing of the oven was poor and was rough / sharp).Rangemaster replaced the cooker - but the replacement arrived and thatToo had damage! At my whits end now. Shouldn’t be like this . They appearTo be living on past gloriesAnd I wonder if like soMany other brands, do they now license the badge and any old pieceOf scrapCan emboss the logo?

Review.Titre: 3.6k Rangemaster induction cooker Poor product\Poor customer service stay away
Review.Contenu: £3.6k Rangemaster induction cooker. Garbage and customer service no better. I was under the impression this was a premium product. A cooker out of warranty but less than 3 years old. I am repairing this myself and found that the replacement parts so far costing £900, fail after a few months with no recourse. Their parts department has no telephone number. Ordered a part that their website says is in stock so I paid for next day delivery only to receive no confirmation email. You cant call as the only contact is via chat or email (because we all have time to write in chat boxes and send and wait for emails).  Finally get through on chat to be told the part isn't in stock, so I cancel the order only to be told it will take 7days to get a refund if the cancellation works. Next day get an email confirming the order and i will be notified once dispatched. I've already supposedly cancelled it, so have to send another email and wait, send another chat message and wait all the while my money is gone from my account. Worst customer experience from both a product and customer service perspective, for your sanity stay away and look to other products because once the warranty is gone on your 3.5k appliance you are on your own. Looking like a new cooker is required but it wont be a rangemaster or any of their sister companies. Next stop twitter.

Review.Titre: I have a Rangemaster Classic all gas…
Review.Contenu: I have a Rangemaster Classic all gas cooker. It is now about 8 years old. One of the ovens stopped working about 2/3 years ago. I haven't been able to get anyone to repair it despite assurances from various engineers that they would call to repair it. My second oven is now not working. An Engineer told me he would call last Thursday. I took the day off work to be at the house when he called. One week later no one has contacted me. I wouldn't buy one of these cookers again, follow up is extremely bad. Avoid like the plaque. Very disappointed with service.

Review.Titre: If I could give zero I would..
Review.Contenu: If I could give zero I would... shambolic repair and warranty service, have been waiting for more than 7 months for a repair to be serviced, doesn't seem to matter how frustrated I get and how many emails I send, nobody turns up to repair, over the past 7 months, I've reorganised work, holiday, to be home for the engineer to show up and nobody ever does, people are booked in, and don't even call to say they won't be coming!  No other choice to leave reviews now as I would not want anyone to pay thousands on a cooker with a warranty, when Rangemaster can't even service their warranty.  Avoid Rangemaster!UPDATE - despite a contact from "customer services" again this still hasn't been resolved, since February, no shows from engineers, no call to say they won't turn up and no follow up  from customer services either....

Our cooker is 6 years old and 7 mths ago one ring failed. This is still not repaired despite weekly promises that it will be. We have been lied to repeatedly by Repairtech (the authorised repair company) and Rangemaster with each party blaming the other. We have used holiday to wait in for repairers that never come and are now having to take unpaid leave and yet again get a call mid afternoon saying they cannot visit to fix the cooker. I expected to wait a few weeks but not months. I feel the product is not fit for purpose and if I could give a negative score I would.

Two weeks,(11/10/23) since I emailed Head office to try and get answers to my concerns regarding my new range cooker and still no response !! I expect better from a company who, is supposed to be very customer orientated. Not happy, after spending a lot of money on their product to receive short shrift .

Review.Titre: We bought a cooker in February this…
Review.Contenu: We bought a cooker in February this year and it has never worked properly. We have found it impossible to contact the company by any other means. Phone numbers on the profile have been changed. Cannot get to speak to anyone. Seriously just looking at a chargeback on my credit card. My suggestion is to avoid.

Review.Titre: rangemaster cookers with No backup service
Review.Contenu: I have a rangemaster cooker, one of the ovens is Gas(lpg) it is not working. I have contacted the supplier they do not have a gas engineer.  I have also contacted numerous gas engineers but as soon as I mention rangemaster they are not interested. I have been in contact with Rangemaster service, what a joke, they said they cannot help.  I have face-booked rangemaster, they did not reply.  If I could leave negative stars I would. Do not purchase a rangemaster cooker. CAN ANY ONE RECOMMEND A NON RANGEMASTER LPG COOKER THAT HAS A GOOD BACKUP SERVICE

Review.Titre: I recently bought a Rangemaster oven…
Review.Contenu: I recently bought a Rangemaster oven for £3000 and it broke down almost immediately with an electrical issue. At this point I had had the oven for 42 days. They said it needed a new part and they sent someone after almost 2 weeks. He came but did not have the part so couldn’t fix it. That was 10 days ago and I’ve heard nothing since. We are a family of 6 and it’s been awful not having a cooker. Rangemaster seem to have no urgency to sort this out and I’ve lost all faith in them. I absolutely would not recommend them and wish I’d gone for a cheaper model as I paid extra for a reputable brand and feel completely let down. This is still an ongoing issue and we are still without a working oven 4 weeks on!

Would give it 0 stars....Within the 2 years both ovens have broken down 3 times. Engineers keep getting called out and they keep replacing the same parts. Customer service is appalling from rangemaster. Requested an exchange and they refused. They even refused to send my complaint higher up. Now stuck with a cooker that keeps breaking down and also have to privately pay for extended warranty. DO NOT buy a rangemaster.

Dreadful communication, crashing silence when a problem arose with my cooker. Agreed to uplift it and didn't follow through. Use a third party for repairs, uplifts, etc, who are useless and simply do not respond (lack of service engineers in this area apparently. This is not my problem!). If Aga Rangemaster can't supply a reasonable, responsive, reliable service engineers they shouldn't be selling cookers in North Wales. The faulty cooker is still sitting in my kitchen 15 weeks later. No uplift no refund nothing.....

Review.Titre: £3000 Cooker delivered damaged but Rangemaster don't care
Review.Contenu: £3000 Cooker delivered damaged. They sent us a factory second. Numerous emails sent but  just auto responses from Rangemaster customer service. Appliance Direct, Rangemster & installers all blame each other but we have to live with the consequences. I didn't spend £3000 to buy a factory second oven I could have bought that on eBay for half the price. Total rip off

Review.Titre: Bought a new Rangemaster  cooker last…
Review.Contenu: Bought a new Rangemaster  cooker last month. It works fine but the glass on the inside of the top door is broken, something we did not notice when it was unpacked.On the warranty page I logged the fault, it say's we need to speak to you. Phoned the number given, it is no longer in use so a number is read out so quick I had to call twice more to write it down.Phoned the second number to be told it is a new cooker so i had to phone another number.Phoned that number, you get put on hold and the line goes dead. Have tried five times.Opened a Resolver case which they don't reply to.Am close to returning it due to the lack of 'customer care'.

Review.Titre: I first contacted rangemaster on the 24…
Review.Contenu: I first contacted rangemaster on the 24 August about the reoccurring fault on my cooker and despite them keep telling me they would be in touch within 24 hours with an appointment I had to phone for an engineers appointment.  He then told me on the day of the appointment that he had the wrong  so hopefully they are now coming next week on the 13 Oct.  I'm keeping my fingers crossed.

Review.Titre: this cooker does not even warrant a one…
Review.Contenu: this cooker does not even warrant a one star. It failed to work from the first attempt. Visits from first engineer from warrantor "it doesnt work, the sensor has gone" he said. Second visit, a mother board and sensor was installed. Still did not work. Third engineer visit...he said that the cooker was a right off.Then the best part of this whole shabby affair was trying to recover compensation from Appliance direct. Incompetent and time wasting.

Review.Titre: Fridge didn't work properly from day 1
Review.Contenu: Fridge didn't work properly from day 1. Constantly gathering water below the vegetable trays which i had to dry out every couple of days and it took 2 different engineers to try and fix but couldn't. Then took about 3 weeks to finally replace after various phone calls chasing and hanging on the phone each time for an inordinate amount of time. I found the whole experience shabby and infuriating.

Review.Titre: im still waiting for Pacifica to…
Review.Contenu: im still waiting for Pacifica to correctly deal with the problem waiting since October. Now the part has arrived for the second time fault!! They are trying to push us back to AO this is an embarrassment I want to speak to someone at range master can I be contacted please.

We were initially impressed with the performance and appearance of our all gas Classic 110. We bought it in 2018. The blurb suggested it should be good for 10 to 15 years. However, after 3 years the spark ignition system failed on the hob top and 6 months ago the ovens failed to ignite even using a lighter. It has only been used by us for daily cooking and occasional family visits. Why should we pay repair costs or find money for a replacement? Not good for an AGA led brand and we're obviously not happy. We're in France now and it's impossible to find an engineer even though the exact same model is branded as Falcon.

Review.Titre: I placed a complaint on Trustpilot and…
Review.Contenu: I placed a complaint on Trustpilot and was asked to send an email to Marie . I did , NO REPLY ! Terrible service . We have a new Rangemaster that is not working and waiting ten days for help ! This cannot be right ?

It is now over a month since our Range Master failed and Range Master, Repair Tech and Capital Services have failed to repair the stove.  It takes two weeks to organise an engineer visit and each time they have the wrong part.  I have reported this to the owners of RM in the USA with no result.  My advice: Don't buy a Range Master or deal with Repair Tech or Capital Services

Rangemaster nexus SE110 induction just outside warranty 2yrs 3mths old cost over £3,500 from new and hardly used. Didn’t expect it to go wrong but outside warranty and no fix for E6 hob error. Fobbed off with 3rd party repair company that can’t fix it apparently unless part to buy is three times cost of part from rangemaster and no guarantee it will fix it. Customer service and Trustpilot reviews terrible. Would have expected more from AGA as supposedly a reputable company. Buyer be aware the cookers only seem to be built to last two years!! Very Expensive mistake…Great looking cooker but no good if it breaks down just after warranty finishes. Buy at own risk.

Review.Titre: Hopeless service on spare parts: sell you a fridge and forget you.     Notwithstanding the reply, there has been no effort to help me, I’m scrapping an otherwise useable appliance for want of a part
Review.Contenu: Trying to get spare parts? Forget it, they don’t want to know and I couldn’t get any information either, chat line hadn’t a clue though they tried. The door mullion on ours just fell apart and it looks like I’ll have to scrap the fridge freezer if Rangemaster continue not to respond to me. Tried email again so I’ll see but previously my email requests for help have been ignored. For an appliance at this price that is disgraceful - my advice is AVOID them, buy something else.  Our AGA cooker is more robust, seems the fridge freezers are Chinese…..🙄

Review.Titre: Beware of Rust and poor customer service
Review.Contenu: Beware of Rust. Oven door saga continues. Having cleaned and cleaned the oven door with their own recommended Chrome and Stainless Steel cleaner product numerous times as suggested in emails rust is still there and confirms it is not food deposits. I was then told to try Astonish- which has not removed the rust either. (Also made me think why do they sell their product cleaner?)  I am so disappointed by the service. Rust is rust and other specs are appearing confirming its an alloy issue within the stainless steel. It would have meant so much if someone had said - we are so sorry - lets put this right instead of numerous emails suggesting I am not cleaning it correctly. So buyer beware - think carefully before buying a product from Rangemaster.

My mother inlaws cooker is 3 months old and the hob is broken 3 engineers have been out and can not fix the problem???? This has been going on for 4 weeks now they are 72 and 84 years old how can this be ok to leave them without a cooker.rangemaster are not bothered they need a uplift code to swap it but rangemaster will not provide it.there product is faulty they are entitled to a new cooker. Will never recommend or buy rangemaster again.for a premium brand there customer service is not premium.

Review.Titre: Broken hobs and less than 7 years old. Appalling customer service
Review.Contenu: I have had my Rangemaster Induction 100 for less than 7 years (all the information I’ve seen online is for a reputable brand that lasts 15-20 years). The induction hobs are completely broken and we have been charged an absolute fortune to replace them. I should also say this is the second time I have had to have it fixed. I made an official complaint and was given more than one excuse. It is poor customer service and I wouldn’t recommend the brand to anyone. I paid for a reputable and expensive cooker for longevity and now realise I wasted my money. The least they could provide is good customer service but it appears that is not something they care about. Do not buy Rangemaster. They are extortionate to fix and the customer service is appalling. Do better!

Unacceptable customer service. Waited 4 weeks for an engineer to come back out to convert to lpg with the right equipment only to be told (when I called to chase) the issue is an installation problem and not covered by Rangemaster.The team have known since the 11th July that we needed to make our own arrangements to fix it but never told us this was the case.As a result we have been without gas and the ability to cook on a hob for 6 weeks. We have 3 young children who are living on microwave meals.

Review.Titre: Eleven days and counting without fridge - despite being 3 months old
Review.Contenu: Bought top of the range range master fridge 3 months ago and now been broken for ELEVEN days and still no fix / replacement at home. Have had to call every day and been nightmare. Have young baby and just been atrocious service. would have expected more from cheapest company

We bought a Nexus 90 Induction in 2019. When it works it is great. However it has always had an intermittent fault meaning 4 hobs stop working, but the smallest front right hob and 2 ovens carry on. This can arise any day and regardless of “load” - for example it can cut when only the middle hob is used on medium power. Sometimes there is no issue for 6 months! This week the issue has arisen every day though, sometimes with the error message e8. Rangemaster have replaced the electronics board twice under warranty, however clearly the issue is not resolved. This is not fun when cooking dinner after school / before bed…looking forward to this being resolved again for a final time and going back to being a rangemaster promoter!

Professional 110 bought just over 2 years ago over £2000 and we just continue to be disappointed. The timer knobs have now fallen off twice, along with the sliver coating. Now the 'Rangemaster' branding / sign has curled itself off too. The buttons on the hood are about to fall off. The grill only works on full power no point in having 1, 2 and 3 because only 3 works.

Review.Titre: Very poor for such an expensive…
Review.Contenu: Very poor for such an expensive product.  Have had 2 rangemaster ranges before both lasting over 15 years each, my latest one had a knob break after only 18 months.  Got no reply to the email sent to the address they provided in over a month, phone call directs you to external company that can not help and then livechat directs you to a spares site that you have to pay for replacement parts.  Clearly not fit for purpose, service terrible and I now see many others with same issue.  What has happened to what used to be a reliable brand/product?!

The fridge was faulty. That happens, but the company subcontract to perhaps the worst repairer I've ever experienced, who made four visits, each time realising they needed some different part, leaving us without refrigeration for over a month. In the end they decided it couldn't be fixed and they arranged for the retailer to replace it.

After our Rangemaster microwave failed, trying to get a repair/replacement has been a nightmare. We have called over 8 times in over 2 months to be told that they will ask and get back with arrangements but no call backs what so ever. We honestly don’t know if we will ever get it sorted and I really don’t lnow what to do. Customer service for rangemaster a big fat zero and will never buy again.

Review.Titre: We bought a gold rangemaster sink in…
Review.Contenu: We bought a gold rangemaster sink in February and 6 weeks ago the gold on the sink has come off it hasn't been scratched and have been very careful with it.No washing up is done in it either.We have contacted them twice and have just being told they are dealing with still not heard back .We have a beautiful new kitchen and it's spoiling it , definitely wouldn't recommend .

Review.Titre: Second review for the same product - still poor
Review.Contenu: Second review for the same product - why do you keep asking?Still rubbish!! A timer function that cannot be used unless you're happy to have the cooling fan running all day. They sent an engineer out to rectify this 'design' fault, clearly don't even know how their own products work. Still have an oven light that goes on and off during cooking - awaiting a replacement bulb (7 months after initial purchase!).

Please do not purchase classic 60 professional cooker. Following on from my review June 22 I'm back here again with 3rd element gone and blowing all my lights. Clearly a serious electrical fault with this cooker but no one wants to assist unless you pay more money to fix. I do not want to attempt to use this cooker again. Can someone take ownership and deal with my complaint

In less than a year and a half our rangemaster oven stopped working twice due to a blown filament. Fortunately been fixed under warranty.The most recent engineer that attended advised me that this is very common in Rangemaster ovens and the part doesn't last more than 12 months and recommended we stock up on filaments and replace the part ourselves next time it goes! These ovens are not cheap and I expected a lot better quality from Rangemaster. Would not recommend!

Review.Titre: Really deserves 0 stars. DON’T BUY RANGEMASTER
Review.Contenu: Really deserves 0 stars. AVOID AVOID AVOID. Dreadful products, awful customer service. Had my Rangemaster cooker for a year, the fan element has gone and the induction hob power unit has now failed too. Now facing the miserable ‘customer service’ even within warranty to get a repair. Save yourself, don’t buy Rangemaster!

We bought out cooker in October 2020.  More than a month ago the small oven control failed.  We called Rangemaster who diverted us to Repair Tech services, who claim they represent Rangemaster, who forced us to pay £230 as a fixed price for the repair.  Repair Tech appointed Capital Services to make the repair.  Within two/three days an engineer appeared who confirmed that the oven control was broken.  We were then given a repair date of 16th August, two weeks or more later.  Today another engineer turned up with the wrong part.  We are now told that the next available engineer is the 29th August, about one month from our original reporting the fault.   That is our cooker has been inoperable for a month. Capital Services has only one gas approved engineer across their entire company.For a company selling a quality product Rangemaster has clearly forgotten the concept of customer service.  You should be ashamed.

Review.Titre: Hi I need to speak to some one about…
Review.Contenu: Hi I need to speak to some one about our range master dishwasher repair it’s been going on for 6 months with Pacifica who just keep cutting us off the phone line once then know our post code this is an absolute disgrace Do I need to take this up with the ombudsman to get a resolution? Can you give me a contact number asap please

Our Rangemaster professional delux oven began tripping the electrics on 1st March.contacted Rangemaster Service and an engineer came on March 3rd. He could not identify the problem. After several phone calls a report was submitted. So eventually today we were informed that a repair was not possible.The oven was only seven years old.We are not happy to have to replace the oven at considerable cost.Can we expect any compensation?

Review.Titre: Individual calls handled by helpful…Poor Warrenty service
Review.Contenu: Individual calls handled by helpful staff but no follow up  to check resolution or coordination with your retailer. I have had an unresolved problem with my fridge freezer since the 14th June with at least 6 calls and you have been unable to obtain the spare part needed. You offered a refund but the your retailer, Appliance Centre in Newark, will not provide the refund and only offer the same fridge/freezer again! As this plastic part may well fail within two years again and you can't get spares I am unhappy that Rangemaster will not intervene with the retailer and own the problem!

Poor quality and disappointing customer service. I purchased the rangemaster dual fuel stainless steel cooker. Significant rust  has developed on the outside of one door and specs are starting on the others.  I was told to clean it! Customer services have provided no support. I am really disappointed with the quality and follow up service. Having spent well over £2000 for a cooker I am very disappointed with the quality and lack of customer care. Think carefully before purchasing a product from this company.

We bought a rangemaster 60cm free standing cooker, within 5 months completely stopped working very disappointed. To make it worse the repair was a absolute nightmare. 3 weeks still waiting for someone to bother to contact me for repairs, each time i call them they keep telling me different fibs.

The 1st induction 60cm professional cooker lasted 6 months then the hob board blow knocking out 2 of the hobs, they couldn't replace the board, told us to get it replaced, we were left for 3 weeks without a cooker as a replacement couldn't be sourced either. Had to get different model 60cm classic induction which, when delivered the oven fan didn't work. when the engineer came to fix it, the hob board on that 1 as he was looking it. Sent it back and got our money back.

Rangemaster pro deluxe 100 duel fuel. Large oven stopped working...clock as well..seems like common prob needs new timer been told. Only 4 years old and lightly used. Avoid...customer service just farm out to óut of warranty repairs'. Understand out or warranty but pretty shody product..should last longer than that!I note that you have replied to my post restating your position that its tough luck and 4 years is reasonable time for your very expensive lightly used oven to work. it will cost me £234 to fix the problem. contrary to your assertion a simple search finds this is a common problem. Your timers appear to be made by Robert Shaw electrics Part A063730 assembled in Slovakia from Chinese parts. The Timer on my cheap microwave works fine still after 25 years. is it a sensible design to stop the main oven working (small one still works) when this poorly made component fails?

My advice: don't buy a Rangemaster. Delivered Cranberry range September. Immediately saw enamel inside oven flaking off. Eventually sent engineer. Sent 2 replacements both had same fault, cracking and splintering enamel. They tried to hide the fault with masking tape but delivery man removed it and off came the enamel. Obviously a manufacturing / finishing fault. Couldn't use main oven for the 6 months we had it. They collected it today. I've ordered a Stoves instead. Such a shame. Rangemaster used to have a really good reputation and they're certainly not the cheapest on the market. Reading all other issues here, I would avoid the misery of buying a Rangemaster

Review.Titre: Avoid at all costs. Faulty products.
Review.Contenu: Avoid. Bought a Rangemaster Induction range. The hob part has broken after 4 years and repair will cost as much as a whole new range. Rangemaster customer service has been completely dismissive and at times bordering on dishonest. Hugely disappointing for this brand.

Review.Titre: This company have sent the wrong model…
Review.Contenu: This company have sent the wrong model sink twice despite numerous emails, live chats and phone calls,It would have saved a lot of time and trouble if they would admit to selling obsolete models as an up to date one.Finally called it a day can’t justify spending any more time and energy on them.Unfortunately I cannot recommend them at all.

Review.Titre: The cooker was damaged on arrival but…
Review.Contenu: The cooker was damaged on arrival but the company would not take responsibility and blamed us.  Made us feel like criminals.The replacement was sorted by Howdens our kitchen fitters who were great.Lovely cooker now , we have one not damaged but would not go to rangemaster again due to the way we were treated.

Rangemaster 2 door, 2 drawer Fridge Freezer bought in Feb 2019 from John Lewis has been written-off by an engineer due to a gas system blockage in May 2023. We've had so many issues with this appliance it is a massive disappointment.

Very poor customer support We developed a problem and reported it they charger me £169 for a call out and said I would be contacted within 2 days A week later I chased them up and then then told me they cannot arrange an engineer and I would get my money back eventually Leaving me with a £1500 broken cooker !!!!Poor product and ever worse after care

Bought cooker and fridge from Rangemaster in the past. Just bought and fitted one of their Belfast sinks and it is pooling in the middle so not all water is draining away leaving scale residue. They have graciously offered to replace the sink but don’t want to know about the substantial labour costs involved in this means I have to fork out £200 in Labour to fix their defective product. Thanks AgaRangemaster. That’s the way to look after loyal customers.

Review.Titre: We have a new Mercury cooker that is faulty! Now we have to wait two weeks for repair!
Review.Contenu: We have a new Mercury cooker that has developed a fault. We were supposed to have an engineer out a week after the fault was reported. That has been cancelled today with no apology just we don't have an engineer!  Now we have to wait another week with a fault that is very annoying as the igniter keeps clicking non stop when the oven power is on so have to unplug.

Review.Titre: This is following on from the…
Review.Contenu: This is following on from the experience we have had since purchasing our mercury cooker. Purchase in February and fault became a problem. Engineer cancelled so we waited 3 weeks. Finally came from auto wash in sittingbourne and identified the problem. Another visit cancelled as waiting for parts. Yesterday was supposed to be fixed but no one turned up! I feel we have been sold faulty goods and have had no contact from mercury rangemaster to check on the status. We feel there should be communication and follow up but we have had nothing. Now we are left trying to sort out this issue and our cooker isn’t working properly.

Aga sell a £1500 boiling tap. We had it two years and it is broken their customer service know nothing about them refer you to an engineer that doesn’t exist. They then tell you to find a plumber yourself, no one knows how to repair. They stick the Aga label on a substandard product which becomes basically a disposable item, unsustainable, poor quality and an mis use of a credible brand name. I have spent thousands with Aga over the last 30 years you have lost me as a customer and l will never recommend you.

Rangemaster have outsourced even in-warranty repairs to a company repair-care that rely on extremely poor sub-contractors. I have been awaiting a month for a repair and despite many many frustrating calls my cooker still doesn’t have a working oven. They also lack a readibly accessible Customer Services dept. A lot of money wasted on a poor service. BE WARNED.

Review.Titre: Rolls Royce prices with back street garage warranty and customer service
Review.Contenu: Purchased a new house with a brand new Rangemaster Kitchener 110 dual fuel installed in the new kitchen The left hand oven and grill do not work and trip the electrics.I have contacted Rangemaster but as I don’t have the receipt of purchase they offer no warranty.What can I say ‘Rolls Royce prices with a back street garage warranty and customer service’

Review.Titre: Rangemaster PROPL60EISS/C Professional Plus Induction Cooker
Review.Contenu: I rarely write reviews on products, but I felt this required one. We bought this Rangemaster after looking at many options of induction cookers, even though there weren’t many reviews available. After only two weeks of using it, the hob gave a loud bang and two of the hobs stopped working all together. Even before this, we were unimpressed with the general build quality, the feel of the dials were cheap and there is a loud cooling fan noise that stays on for a long time after using the induction hobs. After the hob broke, we had to return the item and would not recommend this product to anyone.

A catalogue of errors! The important thing for other potential buyers to know is that AgaRangemaster have outsourced their 'repairs' to another company even when you have just spent thousands of pounds on a brand new cooker. So if you like nothing better than talking to yet 21another person on switchboard who really doesnt give a damn cos its not their problem then go ahead, buy one. Anyone else could do a better job. I bought my cooker over 4 weeks agoand it is still not functioning as it should. The 'repair' company are even worse. I have had x2 cancelled appointments, one because it took them 10 days to realize they needed an LPG accredited engineer. Next appointment in 2 weeks time. Tells you something about how busy they must be repairing Aga Rangemaster products.

Rangemaster RMB70HPNGFGLWithout doubt the worst kitchen appliance I have ever owned.Impossible to clean. Five rings but unless you use micro sized pans can only use two at the same time. Pan stands much to high, pans feel really unstable. Marks easily and did I mention impossible to clean.Absolutely awful

Absolutely appalling customer service to deal with an oven that’s thermostat ran at 80 degrees over. I wouldn’t even give you one star. What ever you do don’t but a cooker from Pacifico who are now Rangemaster. Just stick to AEG

Review.Titre: Rangemaster induction cookers blow up (Two of mine did).
Review.Contenu: The first Rangemaster had a main powerboard blow up. It had to be replaced. The second Rangemaster also had the main powerboard blow up. You have franchised the making of the cooker to a company in Turkey. You have farmed out the process of getting a replacement to two different 3rd party companies (engineers and deliveries). This all take time and we spent most of the autumn of 2022 using calor gaz stoves as we had to replace 2 of your cookers. Frankly I'm surprised you have even asked me to comment on your cookers - what did you expect me to say. Our retailer kindly replaced the last Rangemaster with an AEG induction cooker and it works perfectly unlike the two of yours we had.

We purchased a 60cm stainless steel 'Professional' series cooker. Within months the oven seals refused to stay attached, one of the hob knobs sticks in, and the markings on the knobs and cooker front are almost worn off (used soapy water, nothing abrasive). For £680 this is pitiful quality!

Review.Titre: Our brand new rangemaster has not worked for 3 weeks and counting
Review.Contenu: Our brand new rangemaster has not functioned properly since delivery 3 weeks ago.  Following repair visit today it will be a further 5-10 days. Company has hidden behind service provider and made no discernible effort to expedite matters and take ownership service

Review.Titre: Bought a range cooker which has been…
Review.Contenu: Bought a range cooker which has been great so far to cook with but the design is extremely unsafe especially if you have small children or pets as the gas pipe is exposed at the side. It is fine if you place the cooker between units but totally unsafe if the cooker is placed at the end of units. There is nothing in the product description to warn you of this. I have tried to contact Rangemaster as there seems to be the ability to have an extended side panel fitted so that the pipes are covered but following a discussion on their live chat their tech team have failed to come back to me. A lot of money spent on an item which is unsafe.
It's taken over 4 months to replace a dented oven door, on a new delivered Rangemaster cooker. Had 4 incorrect doors delivered so far, but no contact from Rangemaster ☹️

Review.Titre: Aga don’t believe in customer service
Review.Contenu: The worse service provided from aga. I’ve purchased a 3k cooker last October and cooker keeps igniting itself and grill is broken. The grill never worked! Despite it being a fire hazard aga don’t care. I’ve been chasing them for the last month and half to replace the parts. They mention there is delay but aren’t concerned about my safety! Please don’t waste your money in Rangemaster cookers as you can see my cooker has not gone through any quality and control.
This is my second replacement rangemaster in 2 years. Quality control is sub standard. These units are not cheap, but it seems you are only paying for the brand name.

I am so disappointed in the treatment I have received . My induction hob has not been working since December and I am constantly chasing Rangemaster and their engineers for assistance.This is the second time it has failed in less than two years.If I had a choice I would hand my cooker back and never use their products again.Appalling service!!!!

Terrible Rangemaster convection cooker that broke after a few weeks use and still has not been repaired or replaced 4 weeks later. Have spent hours on the phone trying to sort with no joy. We are now being told to wait another 2 weeks. We have 2 kids to feed. It’s criminal. Never buy one of these appliances

Review.Titre: Our oven was not reaching temperature
Review.Contenu: Our oven was not reaching temperature - not even close. We had to turn it up to 230 degrees to get to 170. We replaced the oven with the same model, and had the same problem but to a lesser degree - which is still not good enough when you spend nearly €700.  Ended up returning the oven for a full refund and purchased a different brand entirely (and happy with that!)Additionally, we could not get an engineer to come to the house as apparently Rangemaster doesn’t pay them enough (here in Ireland) to make it worth their while - they wouldn’t even break even, I was told.

Dangerous ovens do not buy, customer service non existent. Reported beginning of March and still no further forward. Please can you collect your 15 month old cooker and give me back my money. I have lost customers and the bloody will to live

Only had a £3000 cooker less than 6 months and already had to call for repair twice. A new part is needed this time so even though I've taken a day off work and waited in for the repair man, I now have to take another day so he can come back with the part. Its frustrating and inconvenient and I really would have expected better for the price we paid. Massively regret buying this cooker.Update: emailed rangemaster as per response below. Was promised a phonecall and /or email. Still waiting. Will be escalating to trading standards now as cooker is not fit for purpose.

Update on previous review. Had second replacement delivered today and SAME FAULT. Flaking enamel inside oven and masking tape fixed to it. Delivery guys removed it along with enamel! So, all 3 cranberry ranges faulty. Called customer service and asked for refund and compensation as had it since September 2022 and never been able to use main oven. Also, as live in small cottage had to remove doors to accommodate delivery so a lot of hassle for nothing. So very disappointed as believed Rangemaster reliable appliances, but clearly this is a design fault. Where the enamel flakes off, there's a gap for steam to go into the main body via the oven. Very worrying. They assured me this had been inspected before coming out a third time. Clearly not the case. I would not recommend Rangemaster.

I purchased a Rangemaster Elise in June and was advised at the time of purchase that I would receive a free set of saucepans. They have yet to materialise . My stockist advised that a promotion pack to make my claim would be sent directly from Rangemaster which has failed to appear. Today I contacted them and have been  advised by Charley that firstly the claim form should have been with the delivery and then that the Elise 90 oven was not part of the promotion! (Which incidentally finished in April anyway!) It clearly states on my original invoice that a free set of saucepans IS included . I expected higher standards of customer service having purchased an oven fromRangemaster as opposed to other brands I considered at the time of purchase- lessons learned!

Very slow contact to address the problemVery limited availability of engineers to come out (alternate Friday mornings only!)3 month wait to get the spare partWe ended up paying another engineer to fix the problemVery poor overall

The hob stopped working after about 6 weeks and was inconsistent before that. It took 2 weeks to get an engineer out (and they only come to my area on Wednesday). Was going to be another month before it could be replaced so exchanged with Marks Electricals for an AEG which works a treat.

Review.Titre: 2 days post installation one of the gas…
Review.Contenu: 2 days post installation one of the gas burners on my brand new gas hob stopping working. On calling the helpline even though we made very clear that this was a gas hob and not an oven...was asked 3 times to provide a serial number ( no such number that I could see on the appliance or the instruction book) or else rangemaster could not proceed with an engineer callout!! Took 3 emails in my busy life..totally unacceptable. And a brand new gas hob burner not working after 2 days?  Rangemaster...this just does not bode well at all

I am honesty a little aghast that after spending quite so much money on a brand new Rangemaster (a dream I had for as long as I have been planning my house renovation), I have discovered that some of the handles are brass are others are copper coloured! Surely this is not the standard of Rangemaster quality control…

Still haven’t received and update on my missing parts. I’ve been chasing Aga for weeks for these missing parts to fix my cooker. It’s unacceptable to have purchased a cooker less than 6 months and it has had several faults. This case has gone on for nearly two months and I’m without a cooker

Review.Titre: 5 month old cooker broken, poor repair services
Review.Contenu: We have had a Rangemaster induction cooker for about 5 months and it just one day goes ‘pop’ with a big electrical sound and flashes an E error code. 5 months old! Rangemaster can’t seem to decide between 3 different repair services or companies, send two different ones out, we’re told it’ll be done Tuesday or Thursday before Easter, but still waiting, no hob right through Easter weekend, no one else getting back in touch to update us. The one thing we did get told by the repairer was that despite us choosing Rangemaster as a reliable British brand, in fact the cookers are just cheaply made in Turkey. Do not buy a Rangemaster cooker ever, I really wish we could afford to bin it and go back to our previous AEG one.

Absolute shambles! Notified to send receipt and contact retailer to arrange replacement. Then notified that parts had been ordered and received to repair appliance. Contacted Pacifica for clarification. Still waiting. Repair on going now from end of June. Still no further forward.

Bought a cooker in November. The hob exploded on New Year’s Day. They sent an engineer out to fix it but instead of giving him a new part they gave him an already broken circuit board(it had burn marks all over it). It’s taken three months for them to arrange a replacement and I just got another phone call to say it’s being delayed again. Just shockingly poor product and customer service.

£3500 Pounds new cooker   paid for installation etc to avoid issues , item comes packaging covered in oil, unit missing parts , now awaiting the head of customer  services to resolve which is she is doing a bad job off, spare part turned up , engineer job subcontracted to third party who subcontracts it again to another third party who does not turn up ?? Brought Rangmaster before  seems like most things the Quality inspection   and service as gone downhill

Just awful to deal with. Contacted them over two weeks ago via email for a simple part query. Took 9 days for a reply which ignored the information in the original email to be asked it again. Another 5 days before the next reply, which again missed the info given and gave wrong advice. Finally redirected to a third party to ask for their help instead. It just doesn’t make sense. All I was asking for is the specifications for the cartridges used in a tap made by them, this is bread and butter stuff. Customers should be able to look this data up in your website, not trawl through the mud of weeks of useless email conversations for you to still not get it right. Will absolutely avoid all AGA Rangemaster brands in the future because I now just don’t trust you have any idea what you are doing, let alone any sense of wanting to engage with getting the right solution for your customers.

Review.Titre: So more information provided but still…
Review.Contenu: So more information provided but still waiting for a resolution and in the meantime have no cooker. All the information they have requested was not required the first 2 times has been sent, how strange. Please can I have a refund for this dangerous not fit for purpose product. Do not purchase

Review.Titre: Faulty cooker and terrible customer service
Review.Contenu: The hob on our Classic 60 Induction Professional+ 60 Induction cooker ceased to work one month after purchase at end of March this year. Lots of problems trying to arrange repair and then replacement. Eventually a replacement was supposed to be delivered 6th June but this was cancelled by Rangemaster a week or so beforehand due to no stock! Had it taken away by currys, who we bought it through, last week and bought replacement (not Rangemaster) from a different retailer. Still waiting for our refund to pay for our replacement but have just been told today that it will be in the form of a Currys giftcard which is of no use to us. This will not pay for our new cooker which is on credit card! I am still trying to sort it out. An extremely bad experience all round dealing with both parties. And obviously, the product was not fit for purpose.

Review.Titre: Our induction hob ceased to work on…
Review.Contenu: Our induction hob ceased to work on Xmas day. £168 pd for engineer to tell us it was a design fault and was going to cost over £1300! Rangemaster kindly agreed to replace it FOC as it was a design fault. However it took over 13 weeks, several phonecalls and emails and 4 replacement hobs to get the job completed. We are still left with 2 of the faulty replacement hobs.

Review.Titre: Reported a fault last December no…
Review.Contenu: Reported a fault last December no resolutionReported a fault last December, on a 9 month old professional + freestanding cooker. That problem has yet to be resolved. On the 9th of this month, the bottom oven developed a fault. Engineer was quick to come and look , but by the time he came, the oven stopped working completely. Turns out we have a burnt out selector switch, and a burnt out wiring harness. The harness situation is worrying us as that seems dangerous to me. Can’t get hold of rangemaster, phone diverts to their engineers who want to order spare parts, but don’t know how long they will take to ship. In the meantime, I am left with no main oven plus the original faults (3 months!!) . Shoddy customer service. Think twice before buying from this companyDate of experience: March 22, 2023

Review.Titre: Shoddy customer service when things go wrong
Review.Contenu: Reported a fault last December, on a 9 month old professional + freestanding cooker. That problem has yet to be resolved. On the 9th of this month, the bottom oven developed a fault. Engineer was quick to come and look , but by the time he came, the oven stopped working completely. Turns out we have a burnt out selector switch, and a burnt out wiring harness. The harness situation is worrying us as that seems dangerous to me. Can’t get hold of rangemaster, phone diverts to their engineers who want to order spare parts, but don’t know how long they will take to ship. In the meantime, I am left with no main oven plus the original faults (3 months!!) . Shoddy customer service. Think twice before buying from this companyDate of experience: March 22, 2023Date of experience: March

Quality awful.... I had a range master classic black for 17yrs brilliant, change of kitchen went for range master elite in cream... Sign elite has steamed off from the oven, the sign "Rangemaster" has come off, and now the bar over the oven has be come (bubble)... The hob went after 2yrs 4months, got a report and they had to replace along with the retailer... Not fit for purpose, not reasonable amount time for the amount we paid... Consumers act 2015.......please be aware of your rights and not a warranty! Range master your quality is awfully, I brought my second oven in good faith.... I wish I hadn't

Fridge Freezer RDXD21Expensive fridge, but very baffled by the top drawer “freezer” it’s too cold for a fridge and not cold enough for a freezer. Bit of a waste of space and trying to get any response from Rangemaster? Well good luck with that.

Review.Titre: Sales team great, service team poor
Review.Contenu: Excellent sales service from Alastair at Aga Edinburgh and very helpful delivery team, however downhill from there onwards. The cooker arrived without an LPG conversion kit and adjustment gaskets for the side panel. The Rangemaster service team are slow and unresponsive, resulting in weeks of delays to us fitting our new kitchen. Product great - service a major let down.

I had a online "chat" with Matt Boyle about obtaining a spare part. The chat was quickly terminated with very little help and was abrupt brought to an end. Due to the age of my cooker, he showed no reak interest in helping me. Very disappointed in his reaction to my situation

Review.Titre: How long should a cooker element last ?
Review.Contenu: Four years , two freestanding electric cookers and five oven elements later , once again I am without the oven . Rangemaster replaced my first cooker after repeated issues with failed oven elements . Oven mark two hasn’t been any better with three elements burning out , the last one just over the 2 year warranty . Whilst Dominick on the live chat was helpful in directing me back to Pacifica who manage out of warranty repairs , they have yet to respond . For such an expensive cooker with the Rangemaster credentials  , this is so disappointing not to mention ultimately costly on a yearly basis

Really upset . Rangemaster hob has not worked at all well but thought it might need time . Hob now not working at all ! Reported two days ago and do not have anyone coming to sort out for ten days ? Rangemaster 4 months old ? BAD SERVICE

very hard to get repairs, ending up really costlyParents bought a rangemaster dual fuel cooker in October 2018Then in September 2022 the gas oven stopped working. Very hard to actually get a contact for someone to look at it.Ended up costing over £230 for it to be repaired by repairtech, as rangemaster wouldn't or couldn't help.Less than 12 months later, the main over has stopped working again.My parents thought they were paying for quality, not for a cooker to last less than 4 years before it needs fixing.

Someone is coming today to repair our cooker! I just wanted to let agarangemaster know that we had a phone call from repair care telling us there was no engineer available so that is why i wrote another angry review but then I got a message from Autowash saying I had got an engineer! Surely there needs to be a system to make sure all your subcontractors know what is happening!

Review.Titre: Cheap knobs and overpriced to replace
Review.Contenu: Went with Rangemaster as I felt the quality was better…I was wrong, not even a year into having the rangemaster classic electric 60cm and I needed to contact the company direct to get 3 of my cooker knobs replace as the plastic coating had pealed off! The communications with the company were dreadful, difficult and complex! I have tried emailing them through the same email address and have received no communication back about the same issue happening again! The knobs on the cooker itself are cheap, they’re also extremely overpriced to have them replaced! Poor quality unfortunately! Oven itself is very efficient, just a shame the standard of the knobs let it down

Review.Titre: Very disappointed after 2 years and little use the grill falls apart.
Review.Contenu: Ever since I've had my cooker (now 2 yr) it's got more and more difficult to light the grill and the top oven. Due to ill health I've been unable to get someone to sort out the problem. This week lit the grill after continually pressing the dial but within 2 min the whole grill panel collapsed into my food. I was lucky the screw that was obviously holding the grill panel up fell where I could retrieve it. After several phone calls I've managed to arrange a gas engineer to call. Surly this shouldn't happen.

Review.Titre: The cooker looks lovely, but we are disappointed
Review.Contenu: The cooker looks lovely, but one of the ovens has already stopped working after only 3 weeks (it won’t ignite).. We reported it last week and are now waiting to hear back on an engineer’s appointment. Also, after only a few uses, there are black marks on the light silver coloured part of the burner rings which are virtually impossible to remove. Overall, we are disappointed as this cooker replaced our previous Rangemaster which served us well for 26 years!

New cooker fitted by engineer only to find grill will not work.not impressed considering the price.told it would be fixed in a couple of days and a week and a half later still not fixed.would be nice to get some feed back from rangemaster as to when they are going to fix or even better exchange the cooker for one that works correctly.not a word yet.

Review.Titre: Both fan ovens do not come up to temperature
Review.Contenu: Both fan ovens do not come up to temperature.  They are both about 10 degrees lower than they should be.  An engineer came to look at the oven within 48 hours of me putting a call into Rangemaster.  However, he told me this temperature difference is within their tolerance levels and he could do nothing to solve the problem.

Review.Titre: Poor tech support for a brilliant cooker
Review.Contenu: Overall I felt the technical support was lacking. I was enquiring over our left gas oven which sometimes won't turn on properly. All I was given was a phone number for another company (Repairtech) and told to take it up with them. I would have expected more - you know maybe a possible explanation for the issue, or maybe they book in an engineer for me or something a bit more helpful than "I'm not an engineer and the clock works". I genuinely thought given the quality of the cooker itself, the support team behind it might be of more quality. I dealt with Charley

Review.Titre: Nice looking cooker but not worth the money
Review.Contenu: I have a Rangemaster 110 it is about 5 years old, it is a nice looking cooker,but the build quality is very poor compared to my old diplomat cooker which cost half the price.Both oven doors leak heat so damaged the adjacent units all the dials melted and the grill is not very good.I would not buy another one.

I bought a Rangemaster professional+ 90cm cooking range. The main (big) burner has ignition problems and doesn't light the burner. Given the appliance is in warranty I have raised a support request which they took long time to attend. First support engineer assessed that ignition unit along with the burner should be replaced. But the second support engineer came and replaced only the burner. This still leaves me with ignition issues on the main burner, which I will still need to pursue with them.Location: UK but not US.

Customer service is questionable, I have a faulty part on my elise 110 after a few emails back and forth they finally agreed to replace part. The part was delivered and I was advised to contact them once arrived so they could arrange an engineer to fit the part. I have now been trying to contact someone by email for over a week now with no reply back. Extremely poor

Review.Titre: How digital clock timers can make you scream!
Review.Contenu: I bought a dual fuel Classic Rangemaster in January of this year which is fitted with a digital clock that has to be set at the correct time for the oven to work.  I live in an area that has power outages quite often and trying to reset the clock has proved almost impossible.  It took an electrician who I called and paid at my own expense almost 45 minutes to reset the clock.  It is a complete nightmare and is totally unnecessary on a cooker of this price.  What is wrong with buttons to reset the time?  I would not have bought this cooker had I known in advance that something that could be simple is now annoyingly over-complicated. Digital is not always best.  Rangemaster should have a rethink about why consumers buy cookers and what they expect from them. Surely ease of use should be a priority?

Review.Titre: Jobsworth attitude to delivery if ordered direct from Rangemaster
Review.Contenu: As long as people in London have kitchens downstairs (and there are 10s of thousands at least) buying direct from Rangemaster is a waste of time because “they don’t do stairs”.  So despite the fact that we were replacing a 90cm range cooker with another 90cm cooker this seemed to be impossible for them.   We got a cooker eventually from Appliance City.  Rangemaster cookers themselves are very good though,  but you have to go for the expensive Nexus to avoid plastic wobbly control nobs which is a bit off given the cost.

Review.Titre: We bought a free standing Rangemester with many faults
Review.Contenu: We bought a free standing Rangemester dual fuel. on 22/03/23. Model CLA60DFFCR/C . We have had to call out engineers on 3 separate faults. We had a much bigger rangemeaster before for years with no problems.This one has had an oven door handle loose and after fixing the door would not shut. Today we had a lovely chap who diagnosed blistering of paint near the grill and insulation falling out of the bottom of the cooker.This is not a cheap item and if things carry on like this until the guarantee runs out it may be the worst cooker we have ever bought. 3 call outs since the end of March is not good enough. I am expecting some feed back from rangemaster. We have to wait for a time slot and this can be inconvenient.

Review.Titre: Defective grill on new range cooker.
Review.Contenu: My new range cooker was delivered in early January. On installation the ovens and hob were working fine but the grill was not heating up. I contacted Rangemaster who sent out a technician. He ordered a replacement regulator but they sent him the wrong part so he re-ordered. I'm still waiting to hear from them.

Review.Titre: The cooker worked for 3 weeks and now doesn't
Review.Contenu: The cooker worked for 3 weeks - and then the hob failed. Rangemaster do not do warranty repairs and pass it on to Pacifica. So now we have an engineer coming out 2 weeks before Christmas, with no idea if a third party can fix or source a replacement.

AGA/RANGEMASTER ........Terrible after sales service.We bought a 100 cm Falcon dual fuel  range cooker. The cooker is fantastic , but despite me asking several times at the point of ordering to ensure when it was delivered that the LPG kit was included, ( they are free ) it still came without the LPG kit and thus the gas safe engineer couldn't fit it. Appliance direct, the retailer was useless , and Falcon who is impossible to contact wasn't much better. In the end  It took 2 weeks &  about 10 phone calls to sort out and finally a member of Aga/ Rangemaster management took charge and sorted the issue within 24 hours. When you spend the thick end of £5k you don't expect this to happen. None of the staff at Aga/Rangemaster wanted to deal with this and none of them did what they promised they would do. Very disappointing.

It's a great looking cooker - but, when we came to use it  the oven door wouldn't close properly so we had to get the manufacturers to come and fix it. Now the oven light keeps going off when it goes over 220 degrees.....  It really is poor quality control.

Review.Titre: I love the range cooker but disappointing after service.
Review.Contenu: I love the range cooker, but, delivery  was late, despite having been orderedabd paid for 2 months previously. The plate warming rack is impossible to remove from its current (delivery) position. The wrong grill pan and rack were sent and the promised replacement has not yet arrived two and a half weeks later.The cooker hood arrived damaged and 10 days later there is no indication of when the replacement will arrive.

Review.Titre: Second Rangemaster oven in less than18…
Review.Contenu: Second Rangemaster oven in less than18 months has just gone bang. Let's hope it doesn't take them three months to resolve the issue this time, there's a limit to the number of ready meals and salads you can eat. Rather than just putting this appliance in a skip would it not make more sense to get it back and find out what the issue is.Just a quick up date o  this the issues were finally resolved on 16/3  was cooking dinner on 17/3 using the oven and two induction plates. To my utter dismay loud pop which threw the fuse and the hob has stopped working again. Reported this to pacifica and am still waiting for a reply. I just want to get rid of this expensive not fit for purpose waste of money out of my kitchen now if I could afford to.

Review.Titre: BEWARE... SHORT WARRANTY WITH A COMMON EXPENSIVE FAULT!
Review.Contenu: In October 2019 we installed a Rangemaster Professional Deluxe 110 Induction Hob.  It's a very expensive piece of kit, but as someone that cooks regularly and is aware that gas is likely to be phased out... we went for it.  However, after just 3 1/2 years of use we now have an E6 error and the circuit boards on the hob must be replaced...at a whopping £1200!!!  The warranty on Rangemaster is just 2 years... I can't help but wonder if this is why.  Given that the original unit cost around £3000 this repair cost is an unwelcome shock.  We had anticipated at least 10 to 15 years of use from such a large investment.  So... lovely as it is, beware before you purchase.UPDATE:  it is the pans!!  Don't buy 'suitable for an induction hob' ones.  They frequently aren't! Check out page 3 on the user guide.  It is the only place they mention it but the pans must be completely flat, with absolutely no ridges etc.  Rangemaster have been very understanding about our frustration and incredibly helpful.  As have RepairTech.Excellent customer service from Charley at Rangemaster and Mark at RepairTech.

When delivered and fitted one of the gas rings would not stay alight.  We had numerous phone calls and emails before an engineer came to fix the problem.  When we made the purchase we understood that the wok stand would be included.  This was meant to be being looked into, but we have heard nothing.  I would have thought that supplying a wok stand free of charge would be the least that Rangemaster could do after all the onconvenience  and disappointment we have suffered.  I still hope to get a reply on this matter.  It will be a very poor show if I do not get a reply.

Review.Titre: Range cooker: missing items, poor customer care.
Review.Contenu: Bought a range master professional range cooker via Mark’s Electrical, but apparently dispatched directly from Rangemaster. Waited 6 weeks for it to be delivered. Missing hob pan stands, griddle pan and wok stand on delivery. The most frustrating of these is that the hob cannot be used as required as I cannot place pans on it. Rangemaster, almost two weeks later, have only supplied the griddle plate and wok stand and still no information about when the pan support rack will be delivered. Appalling customer service and I would have expected better from Rangemaster and having spent a significant amount of money on the appliance. No apology has been received.Mistakes happen, that’s human BUT how you deal with those mistakes and errors matters.

Review.Titre: Loved my rangemaster classic lpg 90 but…
Review.Contenu: Loved my rangemaster classic lpg 90 but when it came to a service no one was interested cosmetically its lovely but a igniter gone and a few burners not burning properly but no one intrested looking at different make now
Customer service is rubbish.  Induction hob broke after two months.  Waiting three and half weeks for repair.  Call customer service/ warranty area and they haven’t a clue.

Purchased a Rangemaster Nexus 3 years ago, one week ago got a E6 error message have been advised that two motherboards need replacing and the engineer suggested that we replace the whole induction hob as two have gone the third may not be far behind. The cost of the repair is approximately 50% of the cost of a replacement. The warranty of Rangemaster cookers are only 2 years, which on an item that should have a life span much in excess of 3 years and is so expensive seems poor.  Realistically one should not be expecting electronic motherboards to fail in such a short timeframe. The engineer has suggested that that very expensive induction hob safe pans that we use maybe a  cause - to have an induction hob that does not work with all induction safe pans  is a concern

I ordered the toledo 90, it has an oven, separate grill and separate tall oven. The tall oven was completely empty, just a black box - no shelves, or even shelf brackets. I received my oven on the 22nd Jan, on the 25th, I received one big box- with one tiny shelf. Called again, apparently they were out of stock and emails were down so couldn't inform me of any delays. The following week, I received 3 more shelves and 1 shelf bracket... called again on the 3rd, now apparently my last bracket is being sent out this coming week. 3 weeks of not being able to use my oven fully, and each time I had to chase them up to find out what was happening. Deeply disappointed.The 2 stars are for the experience, not for the actual oven - the actual oven so far has been fantastic looks stunning and the switches and dials work effortlessly.

Review.Titre: On first use one of the ovens overheats…
Review.Contenu: On first use one of the ovens overheats and is unusable. Very difficult getting any kind of help. An engineer is supposed to calling us but it is over a week and nothing. Over £3,600 and we feel gutted. Getting in touch is almost impossible unless you have a spare couple of hours and can tolerate the frustration! Very unhappy with our purchase and seems there is no help at all. They have our  money so no incentive to assist us. Terrible.EDIT - an engineer has now contacted us.  However, even getting through to a company shouldn’t ever be this difficult….makes me realise I need to thoroughly check reviews and not base my purchases on past good experiences.  Note for Rangemaster and also AO.COM - please make it easier to actually SPEAK with someone rather than hours holding on. AO.com give the wrong number for Rangemaster so it is another frustration.  Clue: customer service (there doesn’t seem to be such a thing these days). Wish I had bought second hand.

Brought an induction 110 prof range through John Lewis, was ‘issued’ a delivery date with no opportunity to book installation and recycling so now I have two double ovens in my kitchen, neither of which work, and we are two weeks on with no resolution and the two companies passing the buck between them.  This was a big purchase and I am disappointed and frustrated. Terrible customer service.

Review.Titre: Unfortunately the main oven is faulty
Review.Contenu: Unfortunately the main oven is faulty - broke on first use. Customer services good and an engineer is on way within one week- but still poor a brand new oven is faultyUpdate- Marie thanks I look forward to hearing from you. The fault was repaired.. but now the cooling fan has stopped working. I’ve contacted customer services again

Rangemaster Cooker Hood suffering from blistering on paintwork in prominent position, just outside of warranty. Company refuses to address the issues despite being advised that they need to address quality issues for future sales. £600 Cooker hood apparently manufactured from Stainless Steel. Supplied photos of paint bubbling, and magnet attached to hood. Suspect low grade stainless steel, or paint process ineffective. Rangemaster choose to ignore this complaint, despite me advising their processes and QC controls must be flawed.
I needed a reply to what I thought was a simple question, but it turned out to be like 'pulling teeth'  Finally answered my question after around 25 minutes and one failed chat

4 Rangemaster Toledo+ delivered damaged (warped/doors misaligned by factory handling and chipped enamel). 5th attempt had warped pan supports so waited for new ones. Two full replacement sets later we have finally got our new range oven complete. Our last one was 15 years old so hope this lasts as well after such a bad start.

In March 2023 I got a 60cm Professional+ induction cooker. It is a formidable piece of equipment and very quickly became my pride and joy among the household appliances. I read the manual very carefully, changed all of my cookware to the recommended range and followed the daily maintenance instructions.And what's not to like in it? It looks great, it is very practical with its dials and double cavity and seems very efficient.Unfortunately, last week the induction hob broke when boiling water in a large base pan. I followed the troubleshooting section but had to resort to warranty. I have received a speedy response from Rangemaster, however it looks as if servicing has been outsourced and a visit from a technician got scheduled in 2w time. I personally feel that this is a very long time to wait for a visit which is effectively an inspection and does not guarantee working cooker. It is a long time to be deprived of a fairly essential appliance too. An automated message advised that if installation or use is at fault, I will be charged for the visit, which is fair enough, but given the length of time I will lose more than their fee for feeding the family on ready-made oven/microwave dishes by the time I have a working hob again and Rangemaster hasn't offered to reimburse me for this.At no point I received any communication from the servicing team to arrange the visit even though they advised Rangemaster they left me a voicemail. The third party does not seem to have their processes and message passing where it should be.I really hate to leave a low star review for it is a great piece of kit and I am sure formidable engineering went into it. Perhaps my frustration is proportional to how much I appreciated the appliance when it worked, but I feel that a company which is asking a considerable amount for its products and is asking you to buy premium priced cookware to secure item longevity could do better when servicing issues with their products.

Faulty product from factory, control boards in the induction hob failed on first use - still awaiting repair under warranty but process from start to finish will take about a month. Shame really because I chose a rangemaster based on quality.

Review.Titre: Rangemaster Hi-Lite cooker would expect considerably better from a so-called Prestige Brand
Review.Contenu: I bought a Rangemaster Hi-Lite in late 2016 for nearly £2000 and its display has now failed after only 6 years.I contacted their repair organisation and was told that there was no engineer, who was qualified on induction cookers serving my postcode. They offered to send me the part (£125 for a 4 digit display) for me to fit myself - though I am not qualified either!Aga Rangemaster do not appear to have a Customer Services number that deals with any non-routine issues and so all I could do was use web chat.Essentially the web chat said that Rangemaster do not repair their own products if out of warranty and with it being 6 years old they will not repair it either.Rangemaster are offering no solution or means by which it can be repaired.So there you have it, 6 years appears to be the life expectancy of Aga Rangemaster Cookers! Rangemaster appear to only support their cookers for a maximum of 2 years, after which it may not be possible to get them repaired - I find this fairly shocking for such an expensive brand, and environmentally unconscionable.
1st engineer that came did not understand what was wrong.It then took such a long time to get the part required and the engineer then to fit it

Bought the Rangemaster Elise and the induction hob has stopped working twice in 2.5 yrs, warranty only covers the first 2 yrs. I am not confident that after this 2nd repair, which I have to pay for, it won’t stop working again within 12 months. Not great for a +£2k cooker.

Review.Titre: Very disappointed with the service I…
