Review.Contenu: Very disappointed with the service I have received after spending £7000 on a Mercury range cooker, hood and splashback.I purchased through diss ironworks who were hopeless, but i believe it is aga rangemaster who deal with the delivery which was also problematic.Installers didn't want to do do the installation of the range on Monday morning and done everything trying to avoid doing this, there said that they had sent the wrong panel and it would need to be replaced, but they were happy to come back another time.They also advised that they could not fit it with the electricity off even though all the electrics were installed and had been tested.I contacted Diss ironworks and they didn't bother responding to my email concerns, i had to chase up with another email and Hannah advised they will not refund me the install charge as it was a “complimentary service built into the price of the cooker” and the price would be the same without connection.  Thats fine but I have now had to pay over £100 for an electrician and a gas safe engineer to come out and install it properly, both thought the delivery guys were at it.This is a complete joke after spending this amount of money and a cop out of providing any type of customer service whatsoever. Im very disappointed with this company and the lack of customer service is appalling.

Review.Titre: Fault not resolved completely and now…
Review.Contenu: Fault not resolved completely and now the cooker has completely failed to work

Had a small interaction with customer support, expecting them to 'bend over backwards' due to the product being such a premium one, but was left underwhelmed.----Thanks for your reply, but we had to wait 4 weeks for our requested colour samples to arrive, we are still waiting for a quote from the company you re-directed me to, because they don't have your latest model numbers on their records yet...You sell a premium product, my expectation was therefore that my (routine) issue should have been dealt with after one contact, straight away.Hence my being underwhelmed and my score.-----Update 28th Nov, your subcontract repair company said on 17th Nov that their records don't include your product and they would get back to us... no response yet.----Update 12th Jan 2023 - 82 days after initial contact - Aga *may* be dispatching the new door covers that we need on 17th Jan - so really there was no point in being redirected to the separate service company.

Review.Titre: Main ring ignition never worked since…
Review.Contenu: Main ring ignition never worked since new and light indicator has never worked

Review.Titre: All in all, a bit disappointing
Review.Contenu: Arrived with damaged side-panel, and the retailer promised Rangemaster themselves would be in touch to arrange suitable redress. Damage was not a big deal in itself, but when paying over £3k for a range I expect it to be perfect, not a factory-second. Oh, and I've heard nothing from Rangemaster yet, although Christmas has been in the way, to be fair.Induction hob works okay but the control knobs feel flimsy, and the temperature markings on the oven controls are impossible to read unless you squat down so that they are at eye level. Ovens need a good burn-in - I'd suggest at least an hour on full heat - to avoid tainting the first couple of meals.Another small point; the shelf supports on the sides of the oven topple inwards easily unless a shelf is kept in place, preferably half way up the oven or higher. Also slightly disappointing that no solid oven trays are included, just wire shelves. Glide-out shelf supports are a nice touch though.I'd also suggest, on behalf of Rangemaster's retailers, that they give a little more thought to how such a heavy item can be more easily handled. Two guys delivered ours and really struggled - it's quite a lump.

Review.Titre: Sadly the appliance developed a fault…
Review.Contenu: Sadly the appliance developed a fault after only one week.

We have a 60cm Rangemaster and were looking to replace it with a similar Gas/ Electric combination, with the smaller electric oven operating from a 13 amp plug, as that is the electric solution that was installed when we had the kitchen refurbished several years ago.  Looking for a new cooker this "shortcoming" in our electrics became apparent and many models required the "normal" dedicated 30 amp supply.  So, several enquiries of your (Rangemaster) chat line (22nd/23rd March) to see if you had a model to satisfy my requirements - initial responses were no.  Did a lot of internet searching and found model PROP90NGFCY/C on John Lewis and AO - enquired of Rangemaster chat whether this met my requirements fully, to be advised that they could not locate the model ???  This from the manufacturer !  Several customer reviews on AO spoke positively re the need for only a 13 amp supply for the electric oven - so we ordered, in CRANBERRY.  on 22nd March - supply problems so delivery not available before 24th May.  Full marks here - delivery was made, on schedule, on 24th May with AO keeping us well informed.  Installation team were great, cooker looked fantastic, really pleased with how it looked, UNTIL FINAL TESTING - gas engineer very frustrated as Gas Cooker would not light and then flame would go out.  He, in my view, quite rightly, refused to leave it in place as he said it was UNSAFE and so he uplifted and returned and installed our old unit (on which now a burner had failed during removal and reinstall).  FULL MARKS TO AO - they called me within 30 mins to apologise and checked availability with Rangemaster and scheduled delivery/ installation of new unit for 1st June.  I have received a further call from AO this morning (26th May) to advise that Rangemaster cannot now supply the said unit before w/c 5th June - so we are now scheduled delivery for Wednesday 7th June - fingers crossed.  Having had a Rangemaster for many, many years - this new model would be our fourth - I am concerned for the first time re whether quality standards have fallen and whether Rangemaster are as reliable as previously in their support as staff are not aware of model variants and delivery schedules can change at very short notice.  I look to rangemaster to restore my confidence as this experience has now shaken my previous firm belief in a great product with equally great support

Unfortunately our cooker arrived with a chipped grill plate and crooked door.  Rangemaster were quick to arrange for an engineer to come out however.  Otherwise the actual ovens are fantastic - very quick to get to chosen temperature. Safety features are brilliant.

In contact with Rangemaster due to an issue with a cooker extractor hood which had been delivered damaged. Sent all info requested and Rangemaster reviewed and confirmed the unit will be replaced which is good. Only slight frustration is that it cannot be replaced until early October and am waiting for date to be confirmed. Every email sent had prompt response and great customer service.

Ordered my cooker weeks ago to find when opened by delivery men the right door was badly scratched spoke to Rangemaster who would send a new door skin engineer booked for a few days later also looking at left hand door as made quite a crunching sound engineer opened new skin to be yet again scratched and rough metal cutting which cut finger numerous calls another skin checked in factory but now No specialist engineer to fit not sure when it will be done.You pay alot of money and this should Not be happening now to sit back and wait.

Review.Titre: Fallen out of love with Falcon
Review.Contenu: I love Falcon cookers and have owned one for over 10 years. So it was only natural when I moved house that I purchased a 2nd cooker at a cost of £5000. I turned the cooker on for the first time. The Grill, induction and 2nd oven worked perfectly, turned on multifunction oven and bang. Called rangemaster/aga who make the falcon to tell them I had a faulty new cooker. It turns out they don't have their own engineers now but farm it out to 3rd parties. Customer service was useless, asking me if the clock had been set when the cooker does not even have a clock. Finally a guy was sent out from a local repair company after I complained to  Spillers of Chard the company I purchased it from, they quickly sorted it for me as they were not happy with the situation. He quickly found the fault as a live wire which had been damaged from a screw holding the casing which had gone through the cable causing it to earth on the back panel. This had caused a burn mark on the large back panel and the live cable to burn through. He stated this was clearly badly assembled by the company ,the wiring had not been clipped in when it was made. It was signed off by quality control but he thinks it was before the back panel was put on and then the panel was screwed through the cable. The guy who repaired my new cooker was excellent but he wasn't from Aga/Rangemaster. I had no phonecall from Aga/Rangemaster saying sorry just very poor customer service when I called them. This cooker is £5000, it has a glossy brochure and a 3 year warranty but it is only as good as the weakest link and that is the aftercare. If Rangemaster/ Aga are making and selling premium cookers like Falcon , Mercury and Aga and charging a high price then please back it up with a premium aftercare especially when the cooker is brand new. Do I still love Falcon cookers, No! , would I buy a 3rd No ! . Sorry Aga/Rangermaster you have just lost a loyal customer.

Review.Titre: Complained about a damaged AGA part
Review.Contenu: Complained about a damaged AGA part.  AGA denied responsibility and unwilling to help resolve the issue involving a genuine AGA part and their official supplier.This not the sort of attitude I'd expect from a premier brand such a AGA.

A part under the grill had not been fitted, so we did not feel it was safe to use the cooker . It took ten days for an engineer to be sent to fix it. Also, because it is slightly smaller than our original Rangemaster, we have a big gap between it and the work surface.

Review.Titre: Half way through a ‘chat’ with Matt I…
Review.Contenu: Half way through a ‘chat’ with Matt I was cut off and the phone number he had put up disappeared. Then the ‘live chat’ was unavailable.  It would be useful to actually have a telephone number so you could talk to someone to ask your questions.Reconnected to Matt eventually and got the phone number and details of my cooker.  I was disappointed to learn that Rangemaster don’t offer any form of service if a cooker is out of warranty, we have just moved into a property with a cooker in situ and I want to give it some attention - to me, you contact the manufacturer.  I will try the contact number they have given me, but not exactly hopeful.

Review.Titre: Cooker was due to arrive in April  came…
Review.Contenu: Cooker was due to arrive in April  came in July .. when it came the  handles were a different colour to the knobs, sent an email explaining the problem didn’t hear anything . Phoned and  spoke to a very helpful lady, who sent handles out immediately after phone call 10/10 to her, fortunately they were the wrong colour again. So I sent them to a Powder coating company to be colour coded to the oven.

New induction cooker hob stopped working shortly after purchasing then took longer than stated to get a response from warranty repair and earliest can be fixed was two weeks time leaving without ability to use the hob. (Appt is 14th Nov so not fixed yet) I love the cooker and when it works it’s fantastic - service element needs some improvement. Update 14th November - engineer has just been to check on problem - stated needs to order parts but no idea how long could take to come. I have no complaint with the engineer but I am still left without use of hob ( now at two weeks ) and having to wait again to even find out if parts are available - I am becoming increasingly frustrated and disappointed, even more so that this is my first experience with Rangemaster.Edit 15th November; the engineer visit was no more than 5 mins to what amounted to a look at the Cooker took some pictures and said I need to order parts - this I could have done myself two weeks ago instead waited two weeks for someone to come out and say it instead. No further comms so contacted Rangemaster this morning, they sent an email to supplier, I am still waiting for them to update me on what happens next. I do hope I get the cooker working and I get much use out of it - but I am starting to question the brands credentials.
Booked for engineer visit to look at problem with my new induction hob .... no text ...  nothing .....no engineer ..   waited all day ..   nothing since!

Our new Rangemaster 60 lasted 5 days.  Ok we got a rogue induction top from somewhere in Turkey, but where was the quality control check?    We then got  2 hours notice of intent to send an engineer, as we were leaving to visit family in Wales.  This you described as a “cancellation”.   You then offered a new date 2 weeks away - they should arrive this Wednesday but we don’t know when yet (Monday evening).All in all your technical and administrative failings will ensure that we do not buy from you again.   A month on and still no working cooker.

Review.Titre: The bottom drawer doesn't run straight…
Review.Contenu: The bottom drawer doesn't run straight on our new Rangemaster.   It's a fault with the actual frame of the oven so can't be fixed.  A little disappointing for the money.  Quality control needs to be sorted before the ovens leave the factory.

very disappointed, 3 out of the 6 burners are inadequate they do not have enough power. as you look at the stove the right hand oven is slow to cook food. The reviews we read made it look that rangemaster was one of the best we have not found this to be the case.

Review.Pseudo: Lorna Hall Thank you for your order with Animed Direct.
Review.Contenu: My cooker arrived faulty, which is not acceptable on an expensive cooker . When I contacted Rangemaster to tell them I had to use live chat & was told unless I sent a video of the problem they couldn’t help and then couldn’t say when an engineer would come to fix it !

I purchased a Rangemaster Kitchener from Currys. The wok burner gas ignition is intermittently faulty, often needing a few extra seconds to light and occasionally going out once lit. The smallest burner often takes 10 - 20 ignition clicks to light. I reported the fault to Rangemaster. I sent multiple videos of the faults but the wok burner was deemed user error so a job sheet was not sent for this - they sent an engineer from Repaircare to fix the small burner... I was not aware they had decided the wok was user error until he arrived. He cleaned the small burner even though I told him this was a fault from new - It still does not work.  Repaircare insist on sending the engineer on Wednesdays despite me telling them I work nights on Wednesdays. The engineer does not reply to messages so my cooker remains faulty. This is not my first Rangemaster .... I know how to ignite the gas rings.

Rangemaster Arlington SinkVery disappointed with this sink, just be aware of a few points. Spent a lot of money on this as I liked the square design. All I can say, it is cheap and badly manufactured. The metal is so thin, where the tap is fitted, far too much movement. If you press down on any part, you will see the movement as the metal in the manufacture is too thin. I bought this online, if I had viewed this, would not have purchased.Also, the edges were not finished, would have cut my hands whilst fitting. Had to get wire wool and wet and dry to sand around the edges before fitting. Shame, but just to warn you please view this sink before you part with a large amount of money. Hope this helps one person.Response to reply The stability support was fitted under the tap, the metal is very thin on the whole sink and the finish to the edges was shocking

My Rangemsster Professional + 100 Ceramic when installed had two faults. 1/Hob Zone 4&5 appear to have been wired up incorrectly. When you turn on the dial for zone 4 zone 5 turns on. - maintenance call logged2/ The dials for zone 3 & 4 had been switched when assembled! Not immediately apparent but easily changed over. Was there no testing of the appliance in the factory after it had been assembled??Very disappointed given the price of the cooker and it’s heritage. Let’s hope the hobs are repaired. It would be interesting to hear what Rangemaster have to sayUpdate September 2022:I’m pleased to say that the issues have all been fixed, with excellent service from Rangemaster. Thank you

Review.Titre: I contacted Rangemaster some time ago…
Review.Contenu: I contacted Rangemaster some time ago to report a problem with my oven. I am still waiting for a confirmed appointment to repair the above

Review.Titre: Very poor response from range master
Review.Contenu: I have had a problem with my range cooker in that the woke burner and 2 other burners will not ignite also 2 of the disks on the burner are the incorrect size.I have phoned for an appointment to rectify this but was told by the range master service team to take photos of which we did as stated it then took 14 days for a response to ask for more photos and a video of which I have declined as I need an engineer to come out.I feel very disappointed I have still not had a response on this and the cooker is less than a year old very poor at responding to faults and still no engeneer been given to resolve this.

Review.Titre: OCD special - if you like to be continuously cleaning…
Review.Contenu: If you like to be continuously cleaning them this is the oven for you.Screws droppings off from doors and glass falling in. Gas never seems to come out of the hobs straight. Lots little things to clean on each hob.  No way to access all the little holes at the back where the vegetables fall into. British.

Grill door out of lineShards of glass or similar in the main oven cavity - super sharp fragments.Fans vibrate and are oddly noisyScratch on top front of range cookerReported to Rangemaster who did not even have us on their system having registered the guarantee and despite the urgency of glass shards and our being unable to use the main oven, we have to wait for Homeserve to get in touch and book an appointment.Not impressed for an iconic brand such as AGA Rangemaster

Review.Titre: The lovely fridge freezer I bought from…
Review.Contenu: The lovely fridge freezer I bought from Rangemaster looks great but leaks constantly and they have sent an engineer out twice who did absolutely nothing and now refuse any responsibility. Their after care is shocking. Will never buy from them again.
I received a prompt reply which is good but could have saved a lot of my time (and yours) if the manual had made clear which items/functions my particular rangemaster actually had.

Review.Titre: This was delivered to me and although…
Review.Contenu: This was delivered to me and although supposedly checked, it had a damaged side panel and one of the cooker doors did not open/ close without making a noise! A new panel and cooker door has now been ordered and I await this!! No idea how long this will take as no indication has been given to me. Very disappointed to say the least !!

The Rangemaster cooker is excellent, I bought it to replace my old rangemaster which was 14 years old. The delivery was a bit of a disaster. The two guys who brought it said they couldn’t take my old one away as it was still connected to the mains. I disconnected it myself and they took it away. I paid a further £60 to have a local engineer come and connect it and level it. A bit rich when you pay over £2000 for a Rangemaster.

Review.Titre: Disappointing for such an expensive item.
Review.Contenu: The oven fans were very noisy and I had to wait ten days for engineer who came with a part that was a) the wrong one and b) was not needed. All it needed was some oil.Am disappointed that the control knobs on the front of the cooker are so “soft” that if i accidently touch them they are likely to turn on which could be exceedingly dangerous.
Hi, I sent an email to the email addrsss given as live chat was not available about an issue with my fridge freezer and no one responded. I was informed to send it to the email address displayed

Review.Titre: The worst customer service I have ever…
Review.Contenu: The worst customer service I have ever experienced.  Gearing up for my 6th attempt at getting a response from Rangemaster about a new cooker hood which was found to be faulty by our kitchen fitter.  I think I will try phoning again.  No one responds to emails.   Will someone answer the phone this time?  Watch this space.  Would be 1 star but, furious though I am at how this company treats its customers, I do like my cooker.  Just needs a working hood to go with it.

We have had our induction oven Rangemaster for 1 year and already there is a major fault with the job requiring new parts. This is not what I would expect from this product and we have been waiting for the repair for at least a week now. The communication with Rangemaster has been good but the quality of the initial product is disappointing.

Review.Titre: Appliance not fit for Belgian market
Review.Contenu: We bought a new kitchen through Keukenontwerpers in Belgium. Ordered in April, installed in September. Flacon Nexus in back order and delivered on November the 8th. We discovered Keukenontwerpers have bought the Nexus in the Netherlands so the appliance is not electrically fit for Belgium. Adaptation needs to be made but there is no planned intervention for the moment. We are very unsatisfied.

Review.Titre: This is a versatile cooker with gas…
Review.Contenu: This is a versatile cooker with gas hobs and an impressive three electric ovens. However one of the oven doors I am unable to open fully as the door hits the adjoining kitchen unit which is at 90 degrees to the cooker. Therefore I would suggest it’s a great cooker as long as the kitchen units either side of the cooker are in the same plane as the cooker itself.

I bought a cooker that was installed faulty, was informed it would be 48hours for an engineer. Yet the repair took almost 3months. Customer services on Twitter apologised and claimed several times I would receive a gesture of goodwill on repair yet 4 months later I’ve heard nothing or received nothing. Not even a follow up to see if the cooker was repaired to satisfaction!!I love my cooker but customer services is terrible and needs looking at

Its a great cooker, though the after sales let them down, still waiting for them to call me, about the scratch on the inside of the front, main door panel, which has been there since it was delivered. The company I bought it from are fantastic and have been trying to get Rangemaster to phone me to to tell me what happening. So, where's that phone call?

I found AGA Rangemaster spare parts department excellent to deal with, very helpful indeed.Sorry but I’ve changed my view of this company due to recent experience, they are very poor now at responding to emails, I had to telephone them to get an answer, the guy took ages on the phone to look up a part and then directed me to a spares site that was very expensive.Their lead time for new ranges is 30 weeks, their warranty is only 3 years.They don’t seem to like dealing with the public.

While the actual appliance is great, this rangemaster was ordered in February, delivery was promised for June, and it was eventually delivered in early September, with a few additional missed / promised dates in between. Everyone (kitchen company included) was kept entirely in the dark as to when it might appear, and there was no apology at all. Update: Since my review on TP, Rangemaster have contacted me and offered an apology, for which I commend them.

Review.Titre: Having to wait for 7 months is quite…
Review.Contenu: Having to wait for 7 months is quite frankly ridiculous. I work in various factories and normal production doesn't seem to be a problem for them. I had no apology from Rangemaster or indeed the 3rd party retailer I purchased through who insisted that full payment was made up front. The cooker is lovely though once it arrived.

Considering the cost of rangemaster I was very disappointed to notice the enamel coating on the hob is missing in one place.If I can notice this why is it that the quality control in place where the rangemaster is produced cannot??Substandard product and definitely not worth the price.Save your money and buy a better quality product from a more reliable manufacturer

I reviewed my new Rangemaster about three weeks ago and along with the good points also pointed out the problems I’m having with it.  Customer care phoned me on the following Monday morning to say they would like to send a technician out to look at the cooker.  Great I thought, what good customer service!….in the afternoon got a text to say they were trying to find a technician to attend..I live on the Isle of Skye.  I haven’t heard anything from them since….hello customer service..are you there? I would really like my £4000 range sorted. Thank you very much.

Wrote to complain about general unreliability of my aga (costing average of about £250 per year to keep it functional), and a specific problem with a replacement cooker knob that has started spinning round on the actuator spindle.Zero interest from Aga.  "contact the people who sold you the knob" (it's an aga original knob).  And "do you service the unit regularly" (default position - customer fault that the unit doesn't work properly).  We do.  Not much comment or solution offered.  I infer "keep spending, you're doing great".Frankly for a cooker that cost £13,000, I expect better.  Disappointed.  Actually contemplating getting rid of it and buying something that comes with some kind of support offer.

Review.Titre: Very disappointed- given the cost and…
Review.Contenu: Very disappointed- given the cost and expectation of buying a rangemaster -that the wheel was broken on rear- then I had difficulty finding a phone number for customer services which when located cut me off 3 times -sent email never had response-  but in meantime contacted wickes who gave me a direct number which I got through to - initially said they would send out part in post. ! But couldn’t say how easy to fits so now got repair man scheduled for 4 weeks time

Review.Titre: The manual that came with our…
Review.Contenu: The manual that came with our rangemaster classic was confusing to say the least. We needed to convert from gas to LPG and the documentation was unclear, even to seasoned gas fitter. When I went on to the rangemaster website to ask about a conversion kit the person I spoke to was unsure what one I needed or size of jet for the wok burner.

Customer support within warranty - initially booked within 48hrs after request. This than changed to 8 days later leaving our family with 3 young children without a working cooker. To be clear in the end there was no issue with the cooker itself, but our private installation team. However the response time from Rangemaster to investigate a possible issue was disappointing, and we were unable to move the matter forward without putting our warranty at risk. this posting has been updated after reply/actions from Rangemaster below.

Bought a 60cm rangemaster electric cooker in June 2020..When it arrived, had to call engineer because time button stuck so couldn't use oven for 2 weeks..February 2021element burnt out in oven..waited 2 1/2 weeks for repair..also paint bubbling above grill due to heat..jobs still get hot even though I use the bar supplied to direct heat..Not sure this cooker is fit for purpose..regret this purchase

Review.Titre: Need to know what to do.
Review.Contenu: I’m so upset, my Rangemaster professional 110 has such bad quality bits. The small nobs silver bits came off as if it’s plastic and the writing is disappearing where the heat goes on it from the oven. Spent nearly £2000 and it’s looking cheap. The silver bits on the cooker is wearing out already too. So heartbroken.

Our cooker is faulty, we contacted Rangemaster back in November to report it. Engineer visited in January. We've heard nothing. Customer service is poor- no one gets back to you when they say they will. Just feel fobbed off after speaking to someone on 20 Jan and being told they would get back to us the next day. Still haven't heard anything.

Oven ordered 24/9/2020 due 28/11/2020Arrived January 2021 No updates given I had to phone and phoneDelivery eventually booked and time setArrived 2 hours early with 10 mins warning and I was out at workRefused to remove old oven in spite of this being paid forWould only deliver into porch so I had to persuade to leave near kitchen3 parts missingTowel rail, splash back and bottom guardHad to be orderedHappy now but hard work to ensure it was delivered etc

I reported a leaking product and this has been replaced fairly quickly - and was sent this time in a box, within a plastic bag rather than a padded envelope, but it has once again leaked.Apart from the replacement arriving unannounced, I have had no communication at all from Rangemaster.I would suggest that the packaging and seal for the Facia Cleaner be reviewed.

Stylish range. The ovens cook evenly but the doors swing back when opened, causing risk of burning to arms when removing hot trays.The smallest gas burners don't provide enough heat to be effective in boiling liquids quickly. The bigger burners are fine. The griddle is excellent for cooking steaks, drop scones etc. My last range cooker had a lid, which I miss as it provided a useful extra surface in the kitchen.
Bought a range master under mount sink. Now waiting for the third replacement. Sink didn’t lay flat and the next marks in the bowl. Having to wait over two months now. Not a happy customer.

I have wanted a Rangemaster for years and last October I finally got one when we had a new kitchen. Recently I've noticed that it browns unevenly. I contacted Rangemaster and they replied really quickly, asking for lots of details- name, address, postcode, phone number, serial number, colour, purchase and delivery date, retailer, installer details. Then they emailed to say that they would look into getting an engineer booked in. I have heard nothing for a week. Now they want a review on trust pilot! So, I cannot recommend the after care service or Jade's consumer care.

Review.Titre: The product we bought is lovely but
Review.Contenu: The product we bought is lovely. However, the first one delivered was fitted so badly that we had to have a replacement. We then had issues with the second fridge/freezer and had to get an engineer out, again. The door had not been fitted properly this time. Customer service was good, the engineers good but I would rather have had a stress free experience from the start.

We chose this cooker  for looks, what appeared quality and reliability. However after a few weeks it developed faults on the induction hob, leading to 2 claims under warranty for burnt out circuit boards. Although it is fine at the moment, we were very much inconvenienced by having to wait in for engineers.

We had to replace our old S/S fridge/freezer which was 10 years old and couldn’t be repaired.  The new  fridge is very spacious and the freezer compartments are adequate for the kitchen as we have a large chest freezer in the garage.  The only problem is a constant dinging.  We have had two engineers look at it but it still dings!  Would like it more if it was silent……

We had a faulty cooker hud which had no retaining nuts on the inside of the hud to take the chrome rail which was a little frustrating. Rangemaster sent out a replacement which rectified the issue, but I guess this was down to quality control. The cooker is spot on so unfortunately only scored a three. Unfortunate for Rangemaster as had the same product for around twenty years and it was brilliant. So Rangemaster need to keep an eye on the quality of the product you’re sending out.

Review.Titre: A replacement for our existing Rangemaster.
Review.Contenu: We replaced our existing Rangemaster after 20+ years of service with an all gas stainless steel model. Works well but disappointed with:-a)  the grill pan arrangement. Not as flexible as the old model, the pan is on a fixed sliding rack.b)  the control knobs are chrome with black numbers, these are proving very difficult to see at times. c)  the old one had the attached glass pull down cover and we understand regulations now do not allow this, it was very neat and it is a miss.

Review.Titre: Like the cooker but first unit failed.…
Review.Contenu: Like the cooker but first unit failed within three weeks. it took almost two weeks to get Rangemaster's Pacifica technician to attend. No parts available to rectify. It took more than a month of cooking  without a working hob, and a flurry of emails involving retailer Rangemaster and Pacifica, until we finally received a replacement cooker. Currently content.2nd (replacement) cooker blew it's hob in the same way after only a couple of weeks use. Retailer has now arranged for immediate replacement with another manufacturer's cooker with essentially the same features.

Review.Titre: Purchased a Rangmaster Elise in late…
Review.Contenu: Purchased a Rangmaster Elise in late 2020, two weeks ago got a E6 error message that Im being told need to motherboards replacing. Was informed that the warranty of Rangemaster cookers are only 2 year, which is surprising on such an expensive item in the home. Wouldn't have expected electronic boards to fail in such a time, and dont know if any one else has experienced the same. I know have a very expensive repair to happen on a cooker that is hardly used.

Review.Titre: 1)Well constructed but it would be so…
Review.Contenu: 1)Well constructed but it would be so much better if the controls were the other way up so that you don't have to crouch down to see the for example temperature readings.  Also, more intuitive to turn clockwise to turn on, not anticlockwise.2)With such an expensive cooker why is there no timer facility?

I have had 2 rangemaster professionals.  Grill tray keeps rolling back when youbtry to laod up tray. Height is not adjustable enough so larger items get dragged off the tray into the abyss under the grill pan. Chrome handles get pitted with age and become unsightly. Not a bad range though.

We bought our Rangemaster Profession + cooker 4 years ago.  The fan ovens do not cook evenly as they should.  The timer is now not working.  The doors are very difficult to pull open.  Rather disappointed.  We historically had cheaper range cookers and these performed much better overall.

The Rayburn was fitted in December and we are having problems. The cooker continually needs resetting and there are loud clunks when it switches off. Also on a couple of occasions the boiler has carried on charging beyond the programme times. The engineer who fitted it is supposed to chasing this up but we are not getting ant response from him. If this is resolved then I might vonsider giving a better score

Poor door alignment on the grill (not purchaser adjustable). Faulty oven light (not light bulb this has been tested). Oven shelf brackets poorly aligned. Engineer to call and rectify. Very disappointed, for a premium product this is very poor finish and quality control.

Review.Titre: Range master cooker duel fuel I loved my last rangemaster I had it…
Review.Contenu: I loved my last rangemaster I had it for 15 years which made me want another when it came time to replace ,this one not quite as good the gas is not as controllable as last one it doesn't turn down as low ,also the cooker nobs are very light and very cheap looking

We have now had our gas hob-electric oven Rangemaster 110 for ten years. The best I can say is that it's 'OK'. Disappointed with the poor quality of the control knobs: all the silvering has now flaked off our second set (which RM replaced 'free of charge' and I have noted that the fascia floor plate is now rusting and flaking badly too. Why can't both these items be produced in 'brushed aluminium' or another material that will wear better? The left hand oven has never cooked evenly, and there have been alignment problems with the door which I have been unable to resolve, and I suspect hat the seals fail to line up properly. We're now getting to the point where we are thinking about a kitchen refurbishment, and I doubt this cooker nor another RM will be part of it. somehow.

Rangemaster 100 Classic de luxeGood quality product made in the UKTowel rail hides the graduations on the control knobsNot designed as a standalone unit & has to be built in with units either side to hide the crude side view of the cooker.  disappointing

Review.Titre: Oven/hob fine. AO com Dimensions misleading
Review.Contenu: Oven and hob work fine and am pleased with them. Only annoyance is that the dimensions published on ao.com website through which I purchased didn't include the depth of the door handles. My cutlery drawer and pan cupboard door both hit the handles and have had to be modified. Correct dimensions are buried in the manual.

It was long winded.They sent the wrong engineer first who said my hob was unfixable... and needed to talk to Rangemaster to know whether to replace or notThen I got a call saying another engineer was coming (who on arrival said he was not for the hob??) - and such an embarassment although a lovely man - he just turned it on and it worked - so the previous engineer was wrong that it was broken and I never thought to test after he reinstalled it and left - therefore, all we can assume was that the cable had come loose and on taking it out and putting it back by 1st engineer must of tightened the connection... fingers crossed it keeps working

Rangemaster 110 Kitchener...I would check all products of the same value as this one not...my previous one was a Rangemaster and was fab just couldn't get the parts...I did not expect problems straight out of the packaging but hey ho activate your warranty and go through the process well no take this back and send another...you would not expect new parts fitted from day 1 grill on oven out of line annoying very time you look at it new part fitted already as it also had paint off it side panel bent on one side...why cant you just spend £2500 and get something right. rant over

I couldn't find a non-telescopic oven shelf for my Aga Rangemaster. Shannon asked a few relevant questions and quickly found a shelf which he has sent me at no cost - all in one afternoon. I was very impressed by his swift, efficient help.Sadly, the shelf that arrived was completely wrong, both in type and measurement, so I have to revise this review; telephone experience was efficient and fast but in fact, the product delivered was unusable.

Unfortunately, this is a direct replacement for our last rangemaster that we have only had for 18 months & has been repaired previously, is now showing a fault “er47” and the entire hob does not work. However our new one seems to be working very well, without any faults.

Slightly disappointed with a Rangemaster cooker we bought about 18 months ago. The fan element needed to be replaced after 12 months and the hob surface has faded  in places despite being really careful in wiping the surface and using appropriate cleaning solution.

Review.Titre: It took several emails and a long wait…
Review.Contenu: It took several emails and a long wait on the telephone before Patchara answered. She listened to our request for an engineer to assess whether our Falcon wine store could be repaired, and has arranged to contact the dept herself. We await the outcome, but she was totally professional.

Review.Titre: Unable to register the warranty with…
Review.Contenu: Unable to register the warranty with information on the supplier handbooks. Had to be given Rangemasters main tel number. Then automated when selecting the warranty option. Would of liked to speak to a Rangemaster employee.

I would think twice about buying another. Top oven door fell off within days and has fallen off since but we've managed to clip back on. Bottom oven door dropped, Engineer came, found screws missing! This was all within 8 months of purchase.The oven cost twice as much as my previous one so I thought I would be getting a better quality item but not so.

After ten years of complete satisfaction I was shocked to find that my hob was not interchangeable  (3 plates had stopped working). I have bought a replacement and hope it will last longer.One criticism is why no light in the small oven?

Review.Titre: The filter was blocked on my fridge…
Review.Contenu: The filter was blocked on my fridge freezer, but it is hidden away behind a hard to get to panel, we had to have an engineer out, who also struggled to find it! This should be simplified

Surprising and disappointing quality issues requiring two engineers visits to correct.  We were on the point of rejecting the cooker but their Tracey Walker got involved and took the required actions for us.  Thank you Tracey.

Our very expensive kitchen tap (Rangemaster Aquatrend) failed in just over a year. It's the second one to do so  in a similar timeframe (different faults) and the original was replaced after I had to buy a new one and send it back for evaluation. I paid postage and a plumber on call-out, but better than being without a kitchen tap for three weeks while they made their minds up.So when the new one failed (13 months old) I began a conversation which has in fact lasted 3 weeks and so far hasn't seen delivery of the spares which they say will fix the issue. I don't think they will, so I bought a new one as before and now wish to return the dodgy one so they can examine it. This time they say their obligations end with a bag of spare parts and are not even interested in looking at the duff one. Even if the spares do eventually fix the issue, that's another month with no kitchen tap, and another plumber call-out charge. The tap costs all but £400, it's covered by a 5-year guarantee, but imho you're better off spending £20 in B&Q.This situuation has now been resolved in terms of replacements and refunds,  and Rangemaster has done all that could be expected of them.

The product is great and the delivery guys were very pleasant, however they were unable to take our cooker up the steps to our house. There are quite a few steps. I had to arrange for other people to take it up to the house from the garage. Not ideal!!  I was lucky that I could call on others to help but I suspect many people wouldn’t have that option and have to return the goods. A cooker isn’t much use in a garage!!

We recently purchased a new range master oven. It is faulty and the main oven is damaged. My wife emailed you on Monday and was told to expect a call in 48 hours. On Wednesday having not received a response she emailed again. It is now Sunday and we have had no response and you have no customer support outside office hours. We are deeply disappointed at your customer service.UpdateRangemaster got back to me the day after I posted this and an engineer came out a day later to repair it.

I recently bought a Rangemaster Hi-lite cooker hood to match our Rangemaster stove. The installation instruction contained several errors, and the screws provided for fitting the chimney to the body of the hood were the wrong size. On first contacting Rangemaster by email, I had received no reply after 2 days, so I emailed the Head of Customer Services team (Rangemaster promise a response within 24 hours). A few days later I got an email apologising for the delay in responding and asking for details of the model I had bought. I replied immediately and have heard nothing since.Since posting this review I have had a call from Rangemaster‘s technical department; after explaining (again) the errors in the instruction manual, the gentleman I spoke to said he could see what the problems were, but nobody had pointed them out before. I later got an email from customer services which basically responded to my first message, but denied there was a problem with the instruction manual. Both these most recent communications offered to replace the parts for which the screws were incorrect.

Review.Titre: Update to "Looks good and works well".
Review.Contenu: Further to my original review below, about 3 weeks after the cooker was delivered I pulled it out to touch-up the paint work on the wall behind it, which had been marked during the installation of the electric cable. I noticed some brown marks on my brand new limestone floor in the area of the front feet of the cooker.  I tilted the cooker up, rested it on a block and removed the feet.  I was disappointed to discover that they were both rusty.  It seems that they were made of unpainted steel with no protective coating.  In the high humidity environment of a kitchen, this seems to be a very poor quality item.  Whilst the rust stain on my new floor tiles will be hidden when the cooker is in place, it has left a permanent mark.  This is disappointing from such a 'high end' product.  Two new feet are being sent and I am hoping that they will be painted or otherwise protected from moisture.We replaced our old green Rayburn boiler and cooker with a Rangemaster Classic Deluxe in British Racing Green in the same size: 90cm width. It was easy to install and, after just a week of use, seems to be working very well.  The only slight niggle was with the shelf supports in the tall oven, which did not seem to have been fitted correctly as I could not move any of the shelves to the bottom rungs.  However, a bit of pressure on the relevant supports managed to get them seated properly and the shelves now fit.  We have also had to get used to steam coming out of the oven when we open the door; with the Rayburn it used to go up the chimney!

I have owned my Rangemaster Professional+ 110 for 5 years and regret buying it !Within a few months the details on the front of the cooker came off - When I called customer service they literally could not care less and did not help at all.  The cooker keeps becoming unstable so I have to regularly adjust the feet.  I have had issues with the timer buzzer not working and had to replace it - Not really good enough for a cooker that cost over £1900. On the plus side the gas hob is really good, the fan oven seems to get a little hotter than indicated but cooks evenly etc... The standard oven its good but takes time to warm up. The grill is perfect.Overall I would rate it 3 but will never buy another. I'm waiting to write this off and upgrade.UPDATE 2/3/23 : I replied to the message from Ringmaster on the 17th Feb with no reply to date !UPDATE 5/4/23 : Rangemaster offered to send a replacement front for my cooker which I have now received (thank you) however they will not supply an engineer to fit it and have advised this is not a DIY job. They sent me a link to find an engineer, the cost is £156 which I have to pay - I have mixed feelings on this.  On one side they have admitted fault and sent a replacement but on the other I have been charged £156 to fit it.  Never mind, case over no more updates.

Review.Titre: We both agree that the cooker is great…
Review.Contenu: We both agree that the cooker is great however, the instruction manuals are worse than useless.

We ordered a rangemaster nexus SE110 induction from Cooks appliance Centre. It came all packed up but when opened we noticed the top glass and frame was bent (8mm) as though a large weight had been put on the top of the cooker and bowed the glass. Rangemaster were very good and we organised a replacement, but it took AGES to come. It was a new unit from the same supplier Cooks Appliance Centre. This was was even more bent than the first. We eventually agreed after 2 months that they would send out a replacement glass and fitter to replace it. Finally a flat cooker top!The range is great, the experience was not. Judging by the reviews on here, I’m not the only one frustrated by shortcomings. I’ve also noticed bent induction cooker tops on eBay so this happens more often than just our experience.I can only assume that the fault lies in how the cookers are handled during storage and shipping, likely stacked on top of each other. My advice to the operations manager of Aga / Rangemaster I would do one of two things;1. Take control of the delivery of my appliances in house - or via a single trusted partner. If this is too expensive, 2. Beef up the packaging - something akin to a motorcycle crate with wooden supports and able to be stacked. These cookers are clearly being stacked on top of each other resulting in damage that Rangemaster then have to sort out at their cost.  This costs Rangemaster time and money, when it’s actually the logistics companies at fault. So to summarise, Rangemaster is good company (customer service is friendly but very slow) but it needs to work on its supply chain or risk losing customer goodwill.

Cooker was installed but not used for two weeks as our kitchen was being refurbished. First day we tried to use it , the side oven did not work. No fan , no indicator light. Rang Rangemaster who then advised me they DON`T have their own team of technicians to send out directly and farm all repair jobs out to independant companies  - even for brand new appliances ! The third party couldn`t come for 9 days travelling from Liverpool to South Manchester ( was there no one available in Manchester ? ) .  I rang our supplier AO who were very good in the circumstances and we managed to push harder to get a repair engineer out within a couple of days with their help. Rangemaster customer services rep promised to call me to keep me updated on the progress of the repair before it happened and said they`d offer some sort of compensation depending on the fault found ( I didn`t ask for this - we`d have preferred a working cooker  ) . I rang the following day asking for an explanation as to why no one had called me and was told my message would be passed on . I`m still waiting for that call a week later.It turned out to be a loose connection and easily fixed.I couldn`t comment on the function of the cooker itself as we`ve hardly used it so far.We are hoping the cooker lives up to the 5 star ratings we used to purchase it.The company itself however gets 3 stars on this occasion.

The cooker looks great and the ovens are quite satisfactory. The main problem with this cooker is that all the burners have an angle of flame that is almost horizontal and as a consequence the pan sides always burn. This took some getting use to and even now after 10 months, we burn the sides of all pans used. Knob spindle fall off all the time and the ignitors should come with a frustration warning as they are intermittant like hell. Sorry, RangeMaster can't be more favourable to you.

Overall the cooker is great but setting up is a different matter. The instructions tell you to level the cooker by putting a level on oven shelves - one tilts to the left and the other tilts to the right! As for the "instruction pictures" to set up the clock/timer - you`re having a laugh! Yes, I`m old but on showing the book to my youngsters, they couldn`t understand them either!

Review.Titre: We are on our 4th fridge now and this…
Review.Contenu: We are on our 4th fridge now and this one is damaged inside. i will never buy a Rangemaster again

Review.Titre: The cooker did not come with a safety…
Review.Contenu: The cooker did not come with a safety chain or connection hose so had to go out and buy separately when the fitter was here as we assumed it all come with the cooker. Not advised on buying.
Good delivery team. Like cooker very much. Less impressed with AGA/Rangemaster "customer service" as waiting 6 days now for a reply to an email to them.

Review.Titre: Happy with my purchase but not happy…
Review.Contenu: Happy with my purchase but not happy with aftercare  as it took over a year to replace top oven door as was delivered with scratch on it  then sent a silver door when my cooker is black then a black one was delivered but the engineer accidently scratched it while applying it he ordered another which came in all all this took over a year to put right l was told by staff at Rangemaster l would be entitled to compensation  still waiting if you wish to contact  02380668321 mr Gould thankyou

Review.Titre: I like the efficiency of it
Review.Contenu: I like the efficiency of it, but dislike the hard to read buttons. As yet - do not have enough experience.

Review.Titre: We bought the rangemaster pro+ a few…
Review.Contenu: We bought the rangemaster pro+ a few years ago. It looks good and its dual ovens are sizeable and really help when having to cook things at different temperatures, keeping things warm or big events like Christmas. Where the range master cookers really let themselves down is their depth of oven and grill. The grill is really shallow. You are able to cook something like bacon on the slide in grill but anything bigger like browning a macaroni cheese the dish is unlikely to fit in and you have to turn the dish around to grill the other side. Or a pork chop basically is in contact with the grill bars. A simolar size issue happens with the tall oven. They accommodate a baking tray but anything longer like a casserole dish and bad luck you can’t do it. Why the grill and tall oven are so shallow is strange as the cooker is pretty big. We didn’t realise until we bought it and its been a pain ever since, especially considering the cost of the oven you’d expect more. Also all lettering and numbers and chrome seem to be falling off the control knobs. So its not looking great after 2 years. Other than that the oven is great. But a gentle warning if you like cooking you’ll get frustrated.

The quality of the filters in your extractor fan is poor compared to my previous one and the rings in my new cooker are no where near the quality of my previous Rangemaster cooker which I had for 25 years

Review.Titre: Product quality is very poor for what…
Review.Contenu: Product quality is very poor for what is supposed to be a premium product.

Very unhappy, cooker has been not working since the 9th October, and so far I have had to chase up both my engineer visit, and the report outcome from the engineer. After paying a large amount of money for the item I am very unhappy with the poor customer service and very surprised that it has lasted less than a tear before developing a major fault.

Had to prompt twice for a reply, gave a bad review and was contacted immediately- excellent engineer from Pacifica arrived within 48 hours and was extremely polite, efficient, explained everything, a credit to his employers.
Asked about two things about my ludlow fire both they can not supply 👎

The contact with Rangemaster was good and the advisers were quick to respond to the query. But it has been over 10 days and I have yet to receive a call from the engineer to book an appointment. Sent a reminder to Rangemaster but they have not responded.Its an incomplete response. They already have all the information and told me on 3 occasions that they have contacted the engineer to get in touch with me. Still waiting for a call.
Very noisy Subject not as good asBrittania we had to replace

Review.Titre: I absolutely love the cooker looks good…
Review.Contenu: I absolutely love the cooker looks good and cooks perfectly.There has been an ongoing problem since delivery with the Cooling Fan, had an engineer out three times so far! First it wouldn’t switch off, now it doesn’t come on, despite parts been replaced. I so hope it gets sorted completely very soon, alas parts unavailable.

I have only had this ceramic hob for 2 weeks so I feel it is not enough time to give an overall review. This is a large ceramic hob but does not have a large heated ring, so my frying pans do not cook evenly. Largest ring  18cm, most frying pans 24cm+

Had continuous issues with my previous rangemaster which was just over a year old. Although rangemaster sent several contracted engineers (who were appalling) it continued to malfunction.  The induction hob kept cutting out. After threatening to go to trading standards they then sent their own engineer who was excellent and arranged a replacement  The delivery men were very professional and courteous. I'm very pleased with my new cooker so far but early days yet.

Review.Titre: Rangemaster Customer Services and Technical Team got there in the end
Review.Contenu: Contacted Rangemaster for advice on a bulb they are no longer stocking and discontinued for a wine cooler.It took some attempts but the Technical team eventually provided details of where the part can be purchased. Slightly painful process but got there in the end which was the purpose.

Review.Titre: Tried to be helpful but no further forward
Review.Contenu: Problem with Rayburn 480AG, intermittently the boiler fails to ignite although piezo seems to work ok, this might happen every day for a week and then not again for a month or so. The person who picked up my email request tried to be helpful but the tech team were not willing to give any steer that I could brief the engineer with, although to be fair did provide a phone number for when the engineer is on site.

Pleased with most of the range but ongoing problem with the steam oven. Considerable delay in sourcing parts before the engineer came (although he had done diagnostics overs video call). Still not able to use the steam oven and engineer is awaiting technical advice. He has kept me updated regularly and been proactive but still frustrating that I cannot make full use of the range after 3 months.

Review.Titre: We did not get the originally ordered…
Review.Contenu: We did not get the originally ordered rangemaster range. We only learned this o  chasing on delivery date. We had to go with an alternative. This was duly delivered, yet the 2nd oven does not work, nor proofing drawer. Engineer due this week to service with an element with them, presumably this is why the 2nd oven is not working.

Review.Titre: I bought a new Rangemaster cooker in…
Review.Contenu: I bought a new Rangemaster cooker in July 2021.The main reason I purchased Rangemaster was because after checking on line I thought I was buying a cooker manufactured in Britain but when it was delivered there was a huge sticker on the front saying Made in Turkey!!! In March of this year the grill blew and after several visits from engineers I was told that it was a 90 day wait for the spare parts so the retailer replaced the cooker.

Review.Titre: Hoping there are no problems with the replacement
Review.Contenu: Delighted with how our new Rangemaster looks in our kitchen (the dark grey looks fab next to our painted cream cabinets) but unfortunately it needs replacing due to a faulty hinge door. One of the gas burners is playing up too. Sometimes works and sometimes doesn’t! Hoping this won’t be the case when the replacement arrives. The rapid function on the oven is very quick and the tall oven much more spacious than I expected. The markings on the knobs could be clearer.

Having had a rangemaster duel fuel cooker for 23 years, when we moved house and the kitchen needed refitting, Rangemaster was my go to choice for cooker and extractor fan again. My duel fuel cooker was ordered nearly 8 months ago and there is still no sign of its arrival! The extractor fan was fitted a couple of weeks ago. I’m very disappointed, even in these difficult times, at the unacceptable delay in delivery!

Review.Titre: Not as good as the original
Review.Contenu: We replaced our 20-year-old much loved Rangemaster 2 years ago and it's never been as good - various little or large niggles - all dealt with OK by the warranty and service engineers, that aspect was good.  Just a shame we have had to request service engineers.

The clock on our new dual fuel Rangemaster cooker failed after 3 months which meant the oven and grill would also not work. Disappointing as we replaced our old range cooker in preparation for a big family event. Still waiting for parts and repair. We understand COVID is causing delays with parts.  Good cooker when it was working so  hopefully no more faults.

Review.Titre: Cooker is good no faults although…
Review.Contenu: Cooker is good no faults although delivery service is rubbish they change original delivery date for when new kitchen was being fitted to a week later so mess up installation  and notify us by message as we are about to get on a plane to the states so cant question as out of country for 5 days have time booked off work for installation so lose more time of good product but severe lack of communication from delivery services via magnet

Although the cooker is good it does feel a bit lightly built but the main issue i have with it is that I ordered an all gas cooker and the received item has an electric grill.Every website description of the cooker says all gas and not one ever mentions an electric grill.It works fine but I did not want the grill to be electric.

Review.Titre: Like it but cost me extra to change gas…
Review.Contenu: Like it but cost me extra to change gas fittings as it was different to old rangemaster it would not go back to the wall  there was about 1 and a half inch gap

Review.Titre: The grill function on our Elan De Luxe…
Review.Contenu: The grill function on our Elan De Luxe 110 DF was faulty when the oven was first installed.  When the grill was  switched on, the oven circuit breaker would trip immediately, thus cutting off the whole oven. An engineer has just rectified the fault (a short in one of the elements of the grill) and (touch wood) the oven is now functioning as it should.  That said, in this case Rangemaster's quality control seems to have fallen short.

The ovens when they were working were fine.  We had two ovens for less than 3yrs and they both failed with the same problem and are not repairable, and the ovens are discontinued.  No help was offered.

Review.Titre: Not a great experience at the time of writing this review
Review.Contenu: Not a great experience to get an ‘in warranty’ repair on my Range cooker. Rang the Customer Service number and went through the various menu options only to be given a different number to ring. Rang that number and an automated message said that number was out of service, and then proceeded to give out the same alternative number to ring! Emailed the fault to customer service, who then asked for a video of the fault. A week later I emailed for an update on the repair, only to get a reply saying they were waiting for a video of the fault which I had already sent. Pointless to send a new video as the fault by this time wasn’t exactly something that could be videoed. Still awaiting update on the repair.

Bought a sink and when full it leaks from a faulty weld full of tiny pinholes (passed a visual inspection for dents/scratches before fitting)It also appears to be a very soft grade of stainless steel and the slightest touch scratches it.Customer support dont appear to have a clue about how an undermount sink is fitted and have suggested smearing the back of the weld with silicone and it'll "probably be ok"

Review.Titre: Still getting use to this range
Review.Contenu: Still getting use to this range, first time with a Rangemaster and I'm not too sure about it, seems to take triple the amount of time to cook in the oven, the grill not having anything to be able to remove it is a downside for me although I do like the way it slides in and out of the grill. It looks great though!

Running coats are high for this electric cooker and Aga have failed to incorporate useful modern technology that might mitigate this.  I Regret the purchase which is a shame because I have lived with Aga for 50+ years.

The cooker looks wonderful but despite the long wait (30 weeks) it was sent out with a faulty thermostat on the right hand oven.  Ie the oven never switched off.  Are these machines tested by the factory?   To have to call an engineer out on its first use is not acceptable.  I just hope that the two hrs it had to be on before using has not caused further damage.

Review.Titre: I’ve had a Rangemaster cooker and…
Review.Contenu: I’ve had a Rangemaster cooker and chimney hood for 24yrs, I have just changed my kitchen an it was a must I bought a replacement cooker and hood. But after having 3 deliveries of the Rangemaster professional gas cooker all 3 had to be returned as the doors didn’t line up. The quality isn’t how it used to be and I was very disappointed, I did however order a replacement from another supplier and although it’s not perfect and the bottom drawer doesn’t exactly match up we have decided to keep it. Not a cheap cooker so I expected much more. Let’s hope it last me another 24yrs.

Review.Titre: When you spend £2,700 on an oven you at…
Review.Contenu: When you spend £2,700 on an oven you at least expect all the parts to be installed. its taken nearly 2 months to get the missing parts and when they arrive the screws are missing. Awful! Update, gave them an extra 2 stars as they did sort things out in the end and my other purchases arrived quickly and are very good quality.

Lovely range cooker, but issue with main over door hinge catching on the oven structure took the shine off the new experience. Resolved myself and I have to give big credit to Rangemaster as they sent out an engineer to confirm all was as it should be, so the back up service was instant and excellent. Hopefully years of trouble free use to come.

Review.Titre: The oven was out of the 2 year… wntially
Review.Contenu: The oven was out of the 2 year guarantee but had been repaired twice previously with the same fault, a blown element. The repair company gave a goodwill callout eventually and it's now fixed again.

Review.Titre: I have order the cooker and been said…
Review.Contenu: I have order the cooker and been said it will arrive in about 2 weeks, but got it in two months instead. After finally received it , it came  with a defect and had to wait another week for a contractor to come and change one part. It is frustrating when you buy something which you are planing for having a good amount of years and spend quite a lot of money for it but it is with a defect from the moment you receive it.I hope I won't experience any other issue with it.

The Rangemaster 100 cooker is basically good, a bit tight for space on the hob when cooking with several pans. The instruction manual is pretty hopeless, tells you endlessly about how hot things can burn you as we may not be able to work that out, very little about the functions of the cooker. For a high end cooker I would expect a much better manual.

I’ve only had the toledo + for a couple of months and I really like it although the build quality does not seem good enough to justify the large price tag. When it arrived it had what looked like broken glass bits in one of the ovens which we couldn’t figure out where they had come from and the left hand door sticks as you close it. More worryingly we have an intermittent fault where the middle hob ring won’t turn on. I’ve tried emailing customer care  about this but I’ve had zero response.

Unable to contact Rangemaster.My cooker is 2 weeks old and needs a repair under warranty the Rangemaster website links to warranty repairs does not work on multiple platforms and the customer service is closed over the weekend.

When connected tall fan oven did not heat up. Had to wait a few days to get repair man in via Rangemaster. He went straight to the problem and diagnosed a loose connection inside the cooker. He said it was not uncommon for something to come loose in transit. Paid over £1500 for this cooker so a bit surprised that it left Rangemaster without being thoroughly checked so this does not occur.

Review.Titre: Though overall very happy with my…
Review.Contenu: Though overall very happy with my Rangemaster, after having to wait 6.5 months for it to be delivered I was expecting it to be of sound build, but already the righthand door latch has worked loose which is not convenient when it is red hot because you are cooking dinner.

Review.Titre: We waited for our Falcon range cooker…
Review.Contenu: We waited for our Falcon range induction cooker for 6 Months only to find that when it arrived the doors are not accurately aligned. One in particular sticks out and makes a handsome cooker look cheap. It might of been a Monday morning or Friday afternoon build ? I'm surprised it passed quality control though.

Disappointed as arrived with misaligned tall oven door, out of line handles on the same door, and an end piece missing from the large oven door handle.Engineer said holes had been drilled in the wrong place. hard to get through to customer services, when I finally did I was asked to send photos for the engineer. The engineer then cancelled the appointment as said photos hadn't been sent to him! We now await second appointment. for 2.5 k I would expect not to have this sort of quality control...

EDIT 24/11/22... After a few emails offering me a repair to my brand new cooker which I declined I have finally received another cooker today.  Rangemaster could not supply a black one as ordered,  so they sent a green one and a technician to wire it in and swap the doors over from the one that doesn't work and I have to say as always I love it! Thank you to the managers at Rangemaster who tried to come up with solutions to help me.  There were one or two at the beginning who were not helpful at all. I also want to mention the company Rangecookers.co.uk as i bought my cooker through them. They really couldn't have done any more to ensure I received a new cooker asap.  31/10/22 I received a brand new Rangemaster cooker last week, £3000 worth. This will be my 3rd Rangemaster over the years and until now I have had no issues with them, however unfortunately this one has an electrical fault and blew all my electrics the first time it was switched on. This appears to have been caused by a bare wire under a soldered panel and no fault of the electrician. PROBLEM *** Rangemaster customer service are seriously letting this company down. They have received photographs, electrical reports and a full explanation of the events and since then all I have received from them is an email requesting photographs of the "scratches" I am unhappy with!!!! I have contacted them pointing out that I am not complaining about "scratches" but the fact my brand new cooker has blown up!!! ...... and nothing..... nothing at all....I fear trading standards may be my only way forward.

Lovely range cooker but awaiting rangemaster rep to adjust grill door and to replace a central door closure as it has some enamel missing.However it is a beautiful oven and it cooks beautifully. Induction hob great.

Ordered in April 2021 delivery date keeps on moving now 20/09 but still cannot confirm it. Getting a bit fed up with it now, this cooker(Range Master 1100) was expensive enough and all paid for in April. Getting on the verge of cancelling now as to many things are being blamed on Covid and Brexit. Be better of keeping my old Range Master.

Review.Titre: my cooker arrived in good time however!
Review.Contenu: my cooker arrived in god time however!! the rangemaster gas engineer wouldn't fit it as the splash back I had ordered of Amazon was10c.m to smallIsaack in Customer services was so kind and understanding, the cooker was returned within two days I haven't had time to use it yet as waiting for a NEW right size splash backcooking, baking instruction's NOT there again customer services to the rescue and are posting a list outso far ! pleased with "Rangemaster"

After a long running problem with our cooker I am now happy to report that it has finally been resolved thanks to Sophie who thoroughly followed the progress of the repairs through to completion. After she got on our case it all went relatively smoothly...Thanks sophie

Review.Titre: Extractor hood was defective within a…
Review.Contenu: Extractor hood was defective within a week of fitting. Needed an engineer to visit under warranty.On the classic 110 the bottom left door has a meat tray attached, it stops you being able to use or move the trays inside the compartment. They hit each other. Terrible design.

REGISTERED FOR WARRANTY. DID  NOT RECIEVE CONFIRMATION EMAIL AS INDICATED. LIVE CHAT NOT OPERATIONAL. VERY POOR AFTER SALES SERVICE SO FAR. THIS IS A REPLACEMENT RANGEMASTER AND WE ARE PLEASED WITH THE SLIGHT MODIFICATIONS TO THE PREVIOUS MODEL WHICH LASTED 15 YEARS OF DAILY USE

Review.Titre: Happy with my purchase overall but an apology for the long wait and change to delivery dates would have been nice.
Review.Contenu: Happy with my purchase overall, however had to wait nearly 5 months for delivery and then oven was delivered with wrong colour towel rail and handles. Delivery date was also changed twice so it was a long time waiting for my new ktichen to be finished, while company were sat on the £2000+ cost of the oven for all that time.

The engineer arrived within the rescheduled time and completed the repair without issue, but didn't remove the defective part for proper disposalRangemaster had initially sent this survey days before the engineer visit. Naturally i wasn't going to complete it before he did the repair

Upon delivery immediately noticed two issues, right hand door ricks against the magnetic closure and protrudes more on the opening side. The handles on both this door and the grill door are not horizontal. Having requested a call out it seems that there is no adjustment in the handles, which implies either a problem with the engineering or assembly or quality control. Very disappointed, especially as this cooker replaced a 20-year old Rangemaster which had none of these issues.

Review.Titre: I ordered my cooker on 6 Jan not for it…
Review.Contenu: I ordered my cooker on 6 Jan not for it to be delivered on due date but had to wait another two weeks . I did have a courtesy payment made , only for it to arrive with missing parts which I had to order myself . I know there’s covid and brexit, but Cooker eventually delivered 18th may . But I love it now it is here . Love the colour - cranberry.

Review.Titre: The Rangemaster cooker hood we ordered…
Review.Contenu: The Rangemaster cooker hood we ordered from John Lewis was delivered by Rangemaster and installed by a qualified electrician. It stopped working within hours of being installed. It proved very frustrating to get hold of anyone at Rangemaster 's customer service, in spite of several efforts and long waits. Eventually Mac Boyle in customer services listened patiently and ordered a replacement hood, which was fitted today by Rangemaster technicians. 5+ stars for Mac Boyle and the Rangemaster technicians, one star for accessing customer services, hence 3 stars overall. Good - in the end!

Iam extremely pleased with my rangemaster classic 90 for the cooker itself i would give 5 stars however the delivery time was way too long hence the 3 star rating. i paid for the cooker through Currys on 23 rd March 2021 and it was delivered on 2nd August 2021as that is when they first had a delivery from Rangemaster.

Review.Titre: Helpful staff but slow response times.
Review.Contenu: Reported a problem with ice build-up in my fridge. I'd forgotten to register the purchase but the customer services team were very helpful in sorting that out. As advised, I called after 5 days had elapsed with no date set for an engineer visit. I couldn't get through to speak to a representative so emailed and got a standard acknowledgement. It took another 7 days to get the fault fully recorded - via email with one of the helpdesk staff. The staff were very helpful but it is hard to get hold of them on the phone.

Bought a Leckford Deluxe 110, dual fuel. This is my third Rangemaster and have never been disappointed…The reason for four stars rather than five is that, despite this being the most expensive cooker purchased, it did not come with a wok cradle. All other models have.

Review.Titre: Efficient chat service, unlike the email service offered.
Review.Contenu: Matt responded quickly and answered my request. However, that does not excuse the fact that I had to chase for a response to a request made almost one week ago.

Review.Titre: Thank you to Sharon at Aga Range Master…
Review.Contenu: Thank you to Sharon at Aga Range Master who  arranged for free installation of our cooker. My father was in hospital which made it difficult to add these services and update the order via John Lewis customer service. Sharon your help and kindness was much appreciated.

The Rangemaster Pro+ 110 induction hob /fan ovens range cooker is great.The RSXS21 American fridge freezer is also great, but it was delivered with a dent in the door with the control panel - a replacement door took months to be fitted - and also has a mis-aligned freezer door which cannot be fixed.

Eugene was amazing with customer service and a credit to you , she went well above that extra mile... Thank you so much. The reason I gave 4 stars was I never got my range master badge and was delivered a classic back splash and not an elan. Still worried about the extra wire that is poking out in the small oven and was told to be careful how to clean it as the wire is delicate ! Still a bit worried about the steam coming out the back as this took all the paint off my Elan deluxe writing........... and I had to replace the mother board after 2 1/2years is this because of the steam, as another person suggested? ...i had my range master classic for 17yrs and was still beautiful when I sold it... Change of colour kitchen went for the cream elan deluxe... Never again

The Rangemaster ventilation unit above our kitchen cooker is working effectively.  The product is fine.  In terms of after sales service, it would have been better to speak to a person from the Rangemaster team rather than find that I had been routed to an insurance company who registered the warranty but tried to sell an insurance policy for parts and labour that the warranty did not cover.

Rangemaster Classic 60 gasI bought this cooker in April as i had been advised they were the most reliable appliances.Now there is a part gone after 8 months..... engineer arrived a week later, said some fan element gone.I haven't heard anything since so it looks as if I won't have it up and running before Christmas.Someone told me there are spare parts available in Waterford Stanley. I would happily drive there for it if necessary......So disappointedThank you Marie, engineer called and replaced fan.

Review.Titre: Brilliant range until we noticed gas…
Review.Contenu: Brilliant range until we noticed gas oven would light then flame would  go out after trying to egnigte the second time. Called customer services,  who came out to fix the problem with 48 hrs ....something to do with the electrical box wires connected wrongly inside the oven. Ever since worked perfectly.

Bought our rangemaster from AO.comThe delivery was very smooth and the guys from AO.com were excellent.Unfortunately we have found that the rings which surround the gas burners have discoloured within 2 weeks of use do I am about to contact the rangemaster customer services to see what there response is

Your installers were prompt, courteous and friendly.
